reviews.review: The most beautiful views. Postcard perfect views of Table Mountain from Bloubergstrand beach. Lovely place to relax for the day and always a good atmosphere.
Wonderful first view of Cape Town. Great stop on the way to Cape Town for a fabulous first glimpse of the city. Highly recommended detour!

Blouberg Beach - Looking to Table Mountain. Blouberg Beach is situated between Big Bay and Table View Beach. The corner of the beach has some great rock pools to explore. Many photographs are taken of Table Mountain from here, with the waves splashing over the rocks and the mountain in the background. From the beach you can look out into Table Bay as well as look back down the beach at Table View and Milnerton.
Blouberg beach. Early morning strole or jog is the best way to start your day. Evening sundowner as the sun dips into the sea and disappears for another evening is indescribable.

Dip your toes in the cold atlantic. Enjoy a view of table mountain from the beautiful beaches where you can take a long stroll. Every now and then you can dip your feet in the refreshing sea and really enjoy the beauty.

chilly but great. The clean beach and chilly water made for a wonderful short walk after visiting one of the many eateries in the area. Park only where allowed to prevent nasty surprises, and it was recommended to us not to walk at night alone on the beach, however we are not sure if there is a problem or if our friend was over cautious.
awesome.. best place to see table mountain from Bloubergstrand beach has lots of eating places. people are very friendly.
Awesome spot for kiting, wind surfing. Perhaps not the best spot for beach goers but the best spot for sure for kiting enthusiasts, wind surfers. Plenty of restaurants, equipment rentals.
the best sunset point in the cape area. great beach to do Kite surfing, walking, its safe there, sometimes very windy and its not said that you always see the table mountain.

The best view of Table Mountain in Cape Town. The water might be cold, but it is one of the most beautiful settings in Cape Town. On a windy day you will see many kite surfers enjoying the South Easter. The beach is long and ideal for a walk up or down the coast. There are bars and eateries on the other side of the road parallel to the beach. Great for a day on the beach.

Views. Long walks, surfing ,tanning or just relaxing this beach offers amazing views with plenty to do on and around the beach, whether you are in for a long or short visit you will definitely enjoy the views

Sea breeze. Amazing views and great activities abound at Bloubergstrand Beach. there is always something here to do for families, friends, couples and tourists. There are fun filled activities to do and excellent places to eat. What makes this place wonderful is the magnificnet sunset as the day ends.

E. Burger. Good place to do body boarding, kite surfing or just relax on the beach. Eating spots close by. Kids will love the beach and you have a lovely view of Cape Town, Robin Island and Table Mountain.
Very clean. Love the beach, it is very clean. It's family and dog friendly. Eden on the bay is close and u can buy a drink or eats. Very relaxing!

Spend a lazy day in the Sun. Sea and sun lovers. Just for you. This beach is perfect to just sit and watch the waves coming in. Walk along the sandy waters edge and just enjoy what nature has to offer. Absolutely breathtaking. do not miss it. There is ample parking and eating places.
Great Beach. Great beach, so many good chicks and the sea was awesome. I've spent many good times here, actually.

sandy beaches as far as the eye can see. Really lovely area to relax in, close to loads of restaurants and bars, and with an incredible view of table mountain. What more could you want?!
.
Fabulous views. Most stunning views of the Mountain and Signal Hill. You also see Robin Island while you walk on the white soft sands down the beach.

EASY TO GET TO AND WHAT A VIEW. This has to be landmark beach in Cape Town, specifically for the view of Table Mountain. It’s a bit of a distance from the city centre and the beautiful beaches on the Camps bay /Clifton side, which are generally wind protected. You just can’t beat the view of Table Mountain from here. Be warned, that if the South Easter wind is blowing (the famous summer wind), you are going to be blown away on this beach. It’s a personal choice, I would go for the view, the kite surfers love it. Public transport (Myciti bus) from the city centre is easy, you just leave the main bus hub in the city, to the main bus hub in Table view and connect onto Blouberg for another perspective of city. Things are different as is any “hood” of Cape Town.

Best back in CT area. While we love the Camps Bay beaches, the rip tides put us off as it meant the kids could do no more than paddle. Bloubergstrand was recommended to us & we are glad we went - really good for body boarding and lots of nice places to eat or have a sun downer along the shore line. The beach was a little dirty, which is why I have not given a 5 star rating.
A lovely beach. A must see beach for visitors from near and far. Great for a mornig wander along the ocean. Super views of Table Mountain and Robben Island.
Different view of Cape town. We were taken to this beach to watch sun down which was spectacular. It is a long sandy beach suitable for families and surfers.
Fab. There are so many restaurants and cafes near Bloubergstrand Beach. The beach itself is beautiful and amazingly clean!!

Best view of Table Mountain. Bloubergstrand, north of Cape Town, offers the best view of Table Mountain. From there the mountain really looks like a table. When Jan van Riebeeck approached to-day's Cape Town by ship from Europe in 1652 he saw a table, hence the name.
Bloubergstrand itself is very much a tourist area with a beach and shops, hotels and restaurants.

for sundowners on the Beach with a view of Cape Town. Although the area is more for families or people trying to avoid the higher prices of Cape Town centre/Waterkant there is a special thing her: The View! Enjoy it sitting on the beach while the sun sets.

Best view of table mountain. This is the area where those great shots of Table Mountain are taken. Lots of kite boarding, surfing, jogging, dog walking. A great place to sit and watch the world go by.

Iconic View or the Mother City. Boubergbeach is not really on the main tourist map and it should be. Here you get a wonderful panorama view of Table Mountain and Robben Island. Walk for hours along this beautiful white sand beach and if you are into a refreshing swim there are lots of safe places. On a windy day it is a treat to watch the kite surfers who come from all over the world for spectacular conditions during the windy season in summer.

Unique view of Table Mountain. From here you can see Table Mountain, Lions Head, Signal Hill and the CBD. The beach is nice and clean but there isn't a lot else around. Come here for the perfect picture of Table Mountain during the day or at sunset. It is a bit of a drive out from central Cape Town but well wort it!

My favourite!. Perfect view of Table mountain, Robben Island. Pristine beach on a winters day. If you want to take the perfect photo of Table Mountain, then come over to Blouberg Strand. I believe the people who live on this side of Cape Town will want to keep it a secret.

Breathtaking. Well it is great to go here when it is clear so you have that famous view of table mountain. It is also great to go when the wind is blowing if you are a keen photographer The kite surfers, wind surfers and surfers are amazing to watch and time seems to pass as you distress watching the action. Sunrise and sunsets from here are also great picture moments

Splendid!. Sunset view is fabulous. The beach is clean and relatively vacant apart from occasional walkers but might have been the time of year ie May. Can be windy but hey this is Cape Town! would stay in Bloubergstrand just so I can enjoy what I consider the best view of Table Mountain.

Picture perfect Cape. One of Cape Towns iconic beaches and views. Well served by transport. However, pl avoid peak hours as traffic can be congested. Great restaurants and pubs along the beach and beyond. Beautiful view of Table mountain. Please enjoy
Beach Time. Blouberg strand( Beach) has a lovely view of Table Mountain. The weather is usually tricky. Water is on the cold side. Well known beach...white sands. Can swim and surf there

Great Surfing. A great beach for surfers and to hang out. It can be tough to find a parking spot but there are always spaces available just a bit farther out,. Police checking for valid license decals and issuing fines if out of date. A great, relaxing surf hang out.

Awesome for wind surfing. Extremely windy. Has some of the best views of the table top and really shows off the view often advertised. It gets very busy and parking is a problem. There are police officers all around and tickets for illegal parking are given fast and furiously. There were a lot of wind surfers despite the frigid temperatures. Not really a beach for tanning or swimming.

Lovely clean beach & View. Love this beach and to see all the people walking, jogging, walking dogs. All the dogs look really happy too! It's a lovely big, wide beach with ample parking and fantastic views. Perfect for a walk, day at the beach, romantic sunset picnic, walking dogs (lots of bins provided for humans to clean up). I just love it here, even if it is windy in season
blouberg. the sun the sea and the wind a wonderful combination. the restaurants and hotels give the opportunity to enjoy
lovely views and beaches. lovely for a walk and picnic, but water is very cold....great views of table mountain and robben island.

Iconic table mountain. Best place for a picture of the mountain.Can get pretty wild and windy,and the surf is quite rough,but one gets totally lost in one's thoughts taking long walks surrounded by such magnificent splendour.great sunsets over the western seaboard.

A lovely beach for walking and walking dogs. From Bloubergstrand beach you have a spectacular view of Table mountain and the city as well as Robben island. Many ships have foundered in this area as Cape Town is also called the Cape of storms.It was a lovely clear winter's day when I was there and could see far out and ships waiting in the bay to enter the harbour. The water is very cold as it is the Atlantic ocean . Walk on the promenade if you do not feel like walking on the sand. Many people take their daily exercise along the beach. Along Blouberg beach are many good restaurants and cafes.

Clean, safe. Bloubergstrand Beach is extremely clean and safe with the most wonderful views of the Ocean as well as Table Mountain. We have been there twice this year already and am planning to return soon for a long vacation
Spectacular view of the mountain. Love the beach so clean. Views are beautiful. Good place to walk or jog or just sit on the bench and look at the mountain.

Picture Postcard Blouberg. Amazing sea, sand and surf. Laze around on the beach during the day and dine at one of the many nearby restaurants at your leisure. Amazing views of Table Mountain and world reknown, Robben Island. (Nelson Mandela's prison) Cape Town's best family beach!
Best view of Table Mountain. The view of Table Mountain when the weather is great is absolutely jaw dropping. Only problem is the beach isn't the greatest.
Sunday stroll with ice cream. Beautiful beach with amazing views of table mountain. Be sure to try the ice cream place on the corner next to the traffic sircle. Best ice cream

Best views of Table Mountain. If you wish to have the best views of Table Mountain and Table Bay, Bloubergstrand remains the number 1 choice. Enjoy a lovely beach walk or a swim (water cold), or excellent surfing conditions. Also a wide choice of numerous waterfront restaurants.

Blouberg Strand, the ultimate view of Table Mountain. If you want to capture epic photographs of this famous landmark, this is the place to be. Every hour and every day the view change from serene to ultra dramatic.

Home away from home. My boyfriend lives in Bloubergstrand and whenever I visit him I go for a walk on the beach. The beachfront is well maintained, safe, and always full of people exercising and walking dogs. Such a lovely atmosphere, I would love to live here all the time!

Table Mountain at its Best. It is what it is - spectacular views of Table Mountain, gorgeous beaches, high-rise apartment blocks sprouting by the day, WIND WIND and WIND, and then again, the VIEW, crashing waves on perfectly white beaches.... and then, as always, I am struck with the thought of what the place would have been without its prefect view of the Cape Tonians' biggest claim to fame, Table Mountain? I will always love going there, but that incessant wind will prevent me from ever wanting to live there! But thank you for all the beautiful pics I have taken there over many decades now!!
Nice n quiet. Very Nice beach oppositie of table berg mountain. A lot of good restaurants in the neighborhood. No problems parking our car.

All senses needed!. To see beautiful Table Mountain from this angle, hear the waves break, smell the sea, feel the sun and wind (I was not brave enough to swim in the cold water and taste the salt water!) is fantastic. Today there were clouds over Table Mountain- we say the mountain has his tablecloth on!

Picture Postcard perfect. Soft white sand, close to shops and restaurants and with the most breathtaking views of Table Mountain.
Capetonians love going here! It's really the most pretty view of the mountain and completely free.

Not called Blouberg for nothing. Bloubergstrand is Afrikaans for Windy Beach, and BOY does it blow there. I don't think I have ever visited this beach when it wasn't blowing hard. Windsurfers abound and there is an annual windsurfing world title competition held there every year. Huge long beach a few miles from Cape Town central. The main attraction for this beach are the sensational views it offers of Table Mountain.

Most spectacular view of Table Mountain. Surf, sea, sand and a view to die for! Iconic to say the least. Watch the surfers, paddle skiers, kite fliers enjoy themselves at this superb spot. If you do nothing else, walk along the promenade and imprint the view into your memory banks.
My favorite beach so far. This is the most beautiful beach I have visited so far. Amazing views, quite and restaurants and pubs are also friendly. One of my favorite places if i ever have to move.
Amazing views. Anytime of the day - but dawn and sunset are just amazing - on a clear day it is breathtaking! One can take long walks or watch the paragliders have fun!

Waves, big waves!. Good beach to walk on, what an endless view. Beautiful view of the table mountain, although it was a bit cloudy today. This place would be fantastic in the summer, now its just a bit cold for me. And a lot of nice shells.

One of our favourite places.. Sit by the sea for an hour or so, walk on the beach or swim in the sea with a beautiful view of Table Mountain across the ocean and there are a few good places to eat. We often drive out to Blouberg for an hour or so quite often & sit and have a coffee at a nice little tea room on the front.

A view to die for!. Bloubergstrand Beach gives one the only really great view of Table Mountain. It is wide, long and clean with many fascinating rock pools at low tide, and most impressive wave action at high tide. You haven't "done" Cape Town until you have visited this beach

the other side. a nice break from camps bay clifton side.....not an option if the South Easter is blowing though....unless you are willing to watch the kite surfers carve up the sea for a few hours...much more affordable than Camps Bay and even cheaper than Muizenburg..an option for those on a budget!

Great beach for a weekend walk. I like this beach for it's beautiful view over the Table Mountain and the fact that it's never overcrowded. The beach is flat and great for a walk or a run. Sometimes it's a bit too windy and I would suggest to ware something warm just in case. Dogs are allowed and mine always has fun there, chasing the waves. It looks like the place is good for at the wind surfing too. You can find a few restaurants around for breakfast or brunch.
So blows the wind. Bloubergstrand is known for its gusty wind but have to say went there the other week and hardly any wind at all - nice place to visit and take photo's

Must to visit if visiting Cape Town. The view is better that from any place in town. I would feel pity if we would leave Cape Town not visiting this place. I would even say. If I would advice to a friends, I would say that it is more important to come here, that to climb this mountain.

Best views of Table Mountain. Bloubergstrand beach is one of the nicest beaches and is child and pet friendly, the views of the ocean and Table Mountain are amazing. This beach is perfect for a long stroll.
Beautiful setting. Awesome sunsets, best view of Table Mountain, great walks, sundowners, surf watching, sandcastles and cold swims

Best view of one of the new natural wonders of the world, Table Mountain.. The view of Table Mountain as seen from Blouberstrand Beach is postcard beautiful and wonderful just to view and inhale the fresh sea air. Medicine on its own!
Best view in the world. Iconic photo seen real time is soo sureal that it is breath taking. Even after living in Cape Tqwon a while back, It is atill amazing
The Best Cape View. We took a stroll on Bloubergstrand Beach at twilight and enjoyed the sunset, the rolling of the sea and the excellent night view towards Cape Town and Table Mountain

Beautiful beach. Miles of sandy beach with the best view of Table Mouintain.Some surf and there is a place to get instruction and lessons just over the road from the beach.Notices about shark awareness as on every beach.Lovely just to walk on the beach. Lots of restaurants and bars along the promenade, including a branch of Ocean Basket where the food is great and affordable.
Walks on the Beach. Beautiful and scenic walks along a white sandy beach. Waves crashing right at your feet. Meet locals with their dogs along the way or pick shells and pebbles as momentous.

Blue Skies, wide open beach and Table Mountain View. My favourite part of Blouberg Beach is the stunning view across the ocean of Table Mountain and the city of Cape Town. But back to the beach that this review is about. Beautiful open sandy beach with kilometres to walk on. Bloubergstrand is also a favourite of kite surfers and any other water sport enthusiasts. Swimming is also allowed and the beach is clean and safe to visit. Stretches of the beach is also pet friendly. If you are visiting in summer, you could plan a whole day on the beach - you will love it. In winter, either doing sport or going for a long walk will feed your soul.
What a place to live!. I recently revisited this gorgeous place that I had the pleasure of livin at in 2013. It really has it all, although the sea could be warmer!

When the weather is right.... ...this is the place to get fantastic pics of Table Mountain and it's side kicks in their various moods from sunrise to sunset. It's also a great place to watch world class kite surfing and get pics of the colorful canopies.

What a Blue Mountain View. It's just like those famous pictures you see of Table Mountain....it's uncanny! And the beach.....it stretches for what seems like miles...dogs love it; people love it and wind surfers have their day....great.

Beautiful place with the mountain and sea coming together.. Bloubergstrand is for certain one of the places that I've always visit we I'm in Cape Town. This place where the sea and Table Mountain are so beautiful seen together, make it worthwhile every time. Ideal place for a picnic.
Great for an early morning or sunset walk. The water is freezing, so only the bravest will venture in. The beach is clean and safe with broad sidewalks next to it.
Kitesurfers paradise. aside from the beach and Table Mountain views it may not be the prettiest suburbs, but if you're a die hard kiter then there's nowhere else to be :)
Best view ever!. Brilliant dazzling beaches! Stretches for kilometres with heaps of parking. Love this area and surrounds.

Grt food awesome view.. Tucked away in a little alcove of the bay is Eden on the bay. Resturants and a view to take your breadth away. You feel you could walk to Robben island at low tide.Real value for money resturants with good food friendly staff and great service. Go and visit when in Capetown.

Amazing Beach town . Fantastic sea views, great food stops, wind and kite enthusiasts. Name it. Beautiful well maintained beaches with plenty of facilities nearby. Washroom and change accommodation on the beach. Great spot

Apart of Cape Town that must be visited.... One of the best views of Table Mountain. Visit various restaurants along beach road. Eden on the Bay is another excellent spot with great restaurants. You won't be disappointed.
wonderful. for the first time on the beach , my kids had a wonderful time. They just went crazy. They just didn't want to leave
The best view of Table Mountain I guess. Probably the best view of the table mountain and CBD Cape Town, this place is cool quiet and awesome
What more can you say,most Beautiful views in the World. In one day you can get the cheapest and best views of Table Mountain just sitting on the beach,Absolutely Amazing Awesome,stunning

My afternoon at Bloubergstrand Beach. I spent a very pleasant, restful afternoon strolling down the beach. The beach was clean and quiet and the view over Table Bay to Table Mountain, Devil's Peak and Lion'as Head just stunning.
Beautiful. Beautiful view on Tablemountain across the bay and nice sandy beach well liked by surfers. Just behind it the road towards The Karoo and Namibia wellcomes.

Windy but Unforgettable. The iconic view of Table Mountain. We were lucky enough to be staying directly behind Bloubergstrand Beach and it was such a beautiful place to be! I so wish we had spent more time there as the short walk we had was brilliant, but there's so much to do in Cape Town! A good quality beach, especially for waves and wind, but you have the absolutely unique experience of lunching with Table Mountain on the horizon! Best place to stay and definitely one you should visit, made for a great holiday.

Excellent views. This is a very relaxing place to go too. The views of Table mountain is the best. You can walk very far along the beach. There are a lot of lovely restaurants along beach road.The water is very cold,but it is a surfer's, runners, kite and kite surfer's  paradise.

Awesome view of Table Mountain. Another favourite of mine to treat guests to the Cape to. Pack a picnic basket wine and a blanket and enjoy sundowners on the beach looking over Table Bay onto Table Mountain.There are free car parks.

Amazing afternoon at Blue Bay. Blue Bay is very relaxed. Many restaurants and cafes line the boardwalk along the beach. Young people atmosphere Eat at Moyo with your feet in the water. Have a coffee at Illiy

Make time for it. By now an iconic and we'll published view/scene! So worth making the drive out and just enjoying.
It can get windy, but that will not ruin your trip. Maybe shorten it.
And why not continue up the coast further for some great spots for food & drink.
Amazing. Probably the best beach .. I have ever been on my travels. Visited 2009 ... Going back 2016. Also great restaurants .... Ie Doodles

Great beach with a view !. We had a few hours to kill so popped down to this beach .. Glad we did , felt like we had the whole place to ourselves .. Lots of space , we felt safe and enjoyed the wonderful view whilst relaxing in the sun ...

Spectacular. View. What an amazing beach got some fantastic photos of table mountain
There are some rally nice reasonably priv
Ce
Best View of Table Mountain!. If you want to get a full view of table mountain this is the beach you need to visit. Excellent sunsets as well.
Views to die for!. A lovely part of town. Super for a walk along the beach front and a nice range of eateries around, should your tummy start rumbling!
Best view of table mountain. No better place to just sit down for lunch and enjoy the views of Table Mountain. Also great for surfing with or without a kite depending on the situation.

Greatest view of Cape Town. A place we enjoy walks on the beach, having a soft-serve on a hot day or simply eating inside the car watching the kite surfers on windy days. Will struggle to beat this place for great views & places to eat.

What a view!. It was a miserable day in the city and so we took a drive out to Bloubergstrand. You simply cannot match this view. The wide open beach and walkway are brilliant. We spent hours in the area walking, sitting on the beach, watching the kite surfers and surfers. A wonderful time of just relaxing taking it all in.

Amazing View. Can be Windy sometimes, but safe and lots to do around.
I live there by the way!
Plenty of affordable and budget holiday accommodation
Good location very good food. Good location very good food , nice staff great fish, we had to wait to be served but no issue and very busy
Good for surfing with beautiful view. beautiful beach and best view of the table mountain, however, the current is strong, not suitable for children to play nearby. Good for jogging and strolling.

Great Location. I had not visited this area for over 30 years! What change! The promenade was excellent with magnificent views of Table Mountain. Great shopping centre at Eden on the Bay. Many great restaurants to choose from. Great ambiance!
Penguin watching. the beach is not that big and there aren't that many penguins to see but still it is worth visiting for taking a few pictures with the cute animals.

Cold but absolutely beautiful. This beach is absolutely beautiful and has a great view of Table Mountain. It is way to cold to swim but is of course understandable because it is the atlantic ocean. Great beach for a sunset stroll but wear a jacket, the wind does get cold.

Greatest views of table mountain. This area provides the greatest views and photo opportunities of table mountain, from across the other side of the bay. It's got a good choice of cafes, bars, and restaurants as well.

Super place to saty. This is our 3rd year in a row that we have stayed here. The beaches are lovely, although the water a little cold even in high summer. Great place for restaurants and bars. We really enjoyed the beach walks.
postcard view table mountain. from this beach you see the table mountain like a famous postcard. its nice for viewing but not for swimming, veryvery cold!
Great view. Nice view of the city and Table mountain. It was windy and there were a lot of wind surfers. Sand is good, but water was cold.

What a view!!. Blouberg strand definitely does look like the post cards!! What a fantastic beach to capture that perfect photo of Cape Town with Table Mountain overlooking the city.
Even if you just have 5 minutes be sure to stop and take that perfect photo!!

Soft white sand.. A group of us took a walk along the beach to the lighthouse in Milnerton and back. A total of about 14km. The beach was clean and there was not any wind. The water is cold, but refreshing for those that ventured in. The views of Table mountain over the sea are spectacular.

Come out to play on the most windiest day!. So on THE most windiest day in CPT I would advise you to go to Bloubergstrand! Locals pours to the beach to come play on the water with their kites / surfboards (wind surfing). We spent nearly two hours just sitting on the beach looking at their moves! Just take sunscreen and a warm jacket! Enjoy!
Best view of the mountain. This is the place to be for a good picture of table mountain, specially during the sunset. Beaches are nice but most of the summer windy

great view of the mountain and stunning sunsets. The wind was below normal which made the walking on the beach more pleasant but it meant the kite surfers stayed at home. The sunsets are awesome from the beach, and the photo's of the mountain are classic. The local fast food places are all reasonable and friendly. Worth the half an hours drive from the city centre.

Best beach in the area.. Great beach day when wind below 15 knots.
Swimming areas must be used as there are strong rip tides that will pull weak swimmer off the shore line.

Post card view of Table Mountain . Popular, clean, vast. But don't let it be windy, then it's mostly good for surfing, windsurfing and kitesurfing. Sunscreen, sun hat and sunglasses... And jacket for after sunset!

Nice place to relax. Nice place to visit and spend few hours on a sandy beach. Best view of Table Mountain. However, it does get very windy there, and it becomes bothersome even to take photos as you hair keeps on flying all over the place; ladies don't forget to bring your hair clips. Have seen many people swimming, but have found the water to be too cold.
Spectacular sunsets. Great restaurants with a spectacular view of Table Island. Spectacular sunsets and a great beach to enjoy.

Lovely beach. Try to go when it is super windy to watch all those kite surfers do their stuff. It is awesome to watch (but not great to walk on the beach then as the sand hurts!). On a clear sunny day, it is also a great place to go for a walk on the beach, with Table Mountain in the back!

Just the best!. My favorite beach in Cape Town by far! the most perfect view, never too busy, bars and restaurants right on the beach, loads of activities to do / hire like SUP boards, cycling along the promenade, kite surfing, surfing etc etc. It can get a bit windy but generally its perfect!

Most memorable view in Cape Town. If you're visiting Cape Town, you simply MUST take a trip out to Blouberg. The view is the BEST in the Cape - there's nothing like seeing the magnificence of Table Mountain from a distance. Nice restaurants in the Big Bay/Little Bay area. Not to be missed.
Your front seat ticket to Table Mountain. Don't miss this beautiful spot. Lots of kite surfing, swimming and a huge selection of restaurants right on the beachfront.
The classic photo shoot. Great place to hang out, easy to park, lots of bars restaurants, surfing, kite surfing., Great view of Table mountain.

the best place in the world. Love the views, Love the white sand, Love the wind, Dog friendly and great places to eat all along the stretch. This could very well be the best place on Earth. Love. Love. Love
Cold water, but very calm and relaxing beach. The water was freezing cold, but the view and beach is great. There are not many tourists/people here so its perfect for families or a lazy Sunday.

wind from the left, just like my windsurfing routine back in the Northsea. Awesome beach.
Launch your windsurfer safely from the "Maestros on the Beach".
No crowds.
Spectacular view on the Table Cloth!

Kite surfer heaven. Beautiful beach; a kite surfer heaven; loads of nice coffee places and restaurants for everyone's taste. The view across to TM is great even if it is cloudy and the mountain has a "cloth" on.

Picture postcard view of Table Mountain. Here's the iconic view of Cape Town ... Prepare to freeze in the Atlantic if you venture into the waters. Best to sit and drink wine and take in the view, unless you're the active type ... Kitesurfing, surfing, the whole nine yards!

Santa Monica with an even better view. You cant' make this stuff up. The view is one of the world's great ones. And if it's a kite surfing day, it just got better. Cross the street and there is ice cream or Chinese food or cold beer or good coffee .And did I mention the view? Just remember, you may well not be swimming unless you bring your wet suit. But for tanning - this is it. And did I tell you about the view?
Great beach. Wonderful shore line with beautiful blue sea and excellent beach.Lots of restaurants for food and drinks.Superb beach for water sports.

Table Mountain with a difference. If you want a spectacular view of a stunning beach with really blue sea and white sands, plus Table Mountain in the backround this is the place to be. This beach is far from the madening crowds, but well worth a visit and take your camera. Please bear in mind the sea is absolutely freezing as it is the Atlantic ocean. The warmer Pacific starts just passed Cape Agulus, the other side of CT.
Clean and Fresh. Blouberg beach is a clean and fresh beach. Was there yesterday taking a walk on the long stretch of beach. Great after a Sunday lunch.

Visit only once. It is simply a tourist attraction with lots of well know shops and hotels. Very western but with the rand so cheap (16=$1) the process are great. A good place to wander and then go for a boat excursion. Great variety of restaurants too. Could be anywhere though.
Classic views of Table Mountain. This is primarily a place to go for the photo opportunty that it presents. There are some nice restaurants in the are for lunch at the same time.

Synonymous with Kitesurfing. What you see immediately approaching the beach is amount of kite surfing going on !!! Its kind of like a number of planes on final into a busy airport, it gives you an immediate rush !The beach however is white, and the sand quite cushy , you just want to bury your toes in the sand, you may even think you on a tropical beach ..... until you go into the water !! COLDDDDer than a fridge.Great view of Table mountain !!!

Peaceful scene. This is a quiet and chill area where people jog throughout the day with stunning views of Table Mountain.For photographers, this is the spot where the best images can be captured on clear days.
Beautiful view of Table Mountain!. Perfect for families, surfers and dog lovers. Great choices of coffee shops and other shops. The view of Table Mountain is breath taking.
Amazing Beach. Perfect white sand, blue water, very intense wind, excellent location for kite surfer. A little bit too windy on many days to enjoy a relaxing day on the beach.

Away from the city hustle and bustle. Blouberg Strand provides for peace and quiet away from the city bowl hustle and bustle. If you want to enjoy the beach and beautiful views of Table Mountain this is the place to be. Beware of heavy traffic to and from town in rush hour. MyCityBus provides for excellent and efficient alternative to connect to town and beyond. Excellent restaurants in the area. Accommodation is typically cheaper than in town. Also many self-catering apartments available, many offering excellent views of the "Table" and Robben Island.

2016 visit. called in here one day, just as they were holding a kite-surfing competition. Fantastic views, but expect there to be high winds. So do not expect this to be a beach day with kids, try Hout Bay for that.

Kevin & Rita Taylor. Visited in January this year and stayed in the area. What a beautiful beach and of course the view of Table Mountain. It can however be very windy around this time of year and can be a little troublesome at times. It certainly did not stop us from taking walks on the beach during the day.

Incredible sunset!. Spent the afternoon with a couple of friends at the beach and watched the sun set behind Robben Island with Table Mountain just to the left of it. Absolutely b-e-a-utiful! Just be sure to carry a jacket should it get windy.

Fun in the sun. Great place for family fun, relaxing in the sun and water sports! Great at low tide for a walk to the island and rock pools, good surf, amazing views of Table Mountain and long stretches of beach for a walk.
Most amazing views back to Cape Town. Nothing more to add , the view to Table Mountain is beautiful, the beach is clean and just great for walking. Visit and judge for yourself!

This is a must for a CPT Visitor. Bloubergstrand is a must for a Visitor of Capetown. There is a beautiful view at the Table Mountain and the Lions Head.It is also a famous Spot for Kitesurfers and for Beachwalking.There is a small Nature reserve, with enough Parking which is my favorite spot for walks and photography.

WINDY but AMAZING. this beach is best known for its kite surfing, sailing and sea shells. It offers a variety of restaurants and coffee shops ...ideal to grab a few sundowners or meals with a wide range of menus i.e. Mexican, Cuban, local or seafood specialities. It has child friendly places, ideal for families with pets, locals and tourists alike. Be careful though: many a times the waitresses add a few items to your bill....Dont just pay. CHECK the itemised bill!

First place to take your visitors. The view from Bloubergstrand Beach is the best - Table Mountain and on the side, Robyn Island. The best time to go is sunset. Watch the windsurfers and kitesurfers do there thing.
Lovely warm beaches. Went to a few of the beaches in this area. The water is much warmer than in Camps Bay. The beaches are fairly clean but do get crowded on the weekends. Views are great.

Stunning views of Table Mountain.. This is definitely an amazing spot to go check out the sunset. Many nice restaurants in the area where you can chill out and relax. If you go during lowtide you can walk to the little rock outcropping and get a very nice panaramic view of the mountain and Blouberg. Also good for a swim, after which you can grab some delicious mini-doughnuts and Ice-cream
Gorgeous ocean. This is such a stunning beach. You can be entertained by kite surfers or just enjoy the scenery. Taking a run on this beach is so good. It is just so peaceful & serene.

Stunning location . We always take the time for a trip to Bloubergstrand Beach it has such a stunning view of table mountain the sea and the kite suffers make it a great place to chill and watch the world go by its one of our favourite places.
Lovely, Private beach. This beach is well situated. Love the privacy from the diners across the road. Very long and open. Will visit this place again

One of the prettiest beaches in the World. At Bloubergstrand beach you can walk for kilometers and really enjoy the view of Table Mountain and big ships waiting to enter the harbor. On a windy day, it is fun to watch the Kite Surfers and there are a few really nice coffee shops along the beach. Visit Carluccis' or Petit Fours and you are welcome to do so in your Kite Surfing outfit. It is a doggie friendly beach and many runners and cyclists also use the broad pavement next to the long straight road that runs past the beach to exercise. You may even find shells and see some dolphins or seals floating by on a good day.
Nice location. Very nice place for surfing and enjoying the sea view. A lot of nice places for lunch and drinks. Not always easy to get a cab if you need one

The most beautiful view of Table Mountain. The view of Table Mountain from Blouberg Beach is nothing short of stunning. The sunset on a beautiful evening has to be seen to be believed. The beach is clean and the sand is white and soft but the sea is generally absolutely pain-in-the-ankles freezing cold. There are restaurants in the vicinity.
The mecca for kite and windsurfers. This is paradise to the surfers! From early to late. Days are long and there is plenty of time to get rid of ones energy. All kinds of surfers try their luck here.

Who beach is it?. One the best beaches to walk has turned into a place where irritable kite surfers glare at people walking their dogs and children playing. The Kites' ropes are all over the show. Unless the kites are directed to a non-swimming beach, I will avoid Blouberg Beach.

Gorgeous views, environment for all.. Great views across the bay towards Cape Town city and the mountain, as well as along the coast towards Melkbos. Beach sand is soft and light, but the water is cold.

This is the view you were looking for. Looking over the ocean with Table Mountain and the city of Cape Town in the background is just fantastic! We went with our rental car which is very easy, no problem to park the car either. You should take the time to walk on the beautiful endless beach, the water is really freezing cold but the white sand is very nice.

A nice day out. A great place to sit and soak up the rays, not for too long mind African sun is a little burny, and watch the kite surfers do their thing. There are a multitude of restaurants and cafes along the front to choose from each one a delight in themselves, it is a pleasant way to spend a lazy morning or afternoon watching somebody else being energetic.

AWESOME. A beautiful stretch with stunning, mesmerizing views of Table Mountain, Lion's Head and Signal Hill. Lots of parking on the beach front. Lots of cafes and restaurants to choose from with a vibrant atmosphere. Braai facilities available.

Bloubergstand - the windy beach with best views.. My family have visited here a few times, lovely beach area to take your kids and see the best views of Cape Town and table mountain. Lovely little bar/pub food restaurant called Blue Peter nearby which is worth grabbing a beer and pizza and sitting on the lawns overlooking the sea. Great!

THE best view of Table Mountain. If you want to see why Table Mountain is one of the New Seven Wonders of the world, you NEED to see it from Bloubergstrand Beach. If you want to see Kite Surfers do their magic on the Atlantic Ocean, this is the place to go and watch them. With stunning restaurants and coffee shops as well as an Ice Cream Parlour, you are SURE to enjoy this side and sight of Cape Town!!!!
An average beach. Bloubergstrand beach is an average beach about 18kms/10.5 miles from Cape Town City centre. If you are in the Blouberg area it is an ok beach but definitely not worth the drive.

Beautiful but cold. Beautiful long stretch of beaches. Clean with a great view of Table Mountain. Restaurants and rental shops nearby. Went on a relatively busy day but manage to find a parking. Went with the intention of surfing but the water was way too cold and winds were too strong. Lots of people were kite-surfing which was nice to watch. It was a very hot day yet the water was icy cold. However, there were still lots of people in the water who didn't seem to mind the cold water.

A must see!! Great view!!. Great view of Table Mountain and Robin Island with soft sand accompanied by loads of restaurants, pubs, fast food shops and much much more. For a great night out hit up one of the many night clubs or taverns. Very popular area over weekends.
Great Views of Table Mountain. Fantastic beach and nice restaurants with wonderful views of table mountain. Well worth a visit if only to get a different aspect of photos of table mountain.
Amazing beach. This is an amazing, long beach; close to Cape Town with lots of parking on the beachfront. Fabulous views of Table Mountain. Very crowded at holiday times in the summer.

Best View of the Table. A good stretch of sand that goes on for miles with an amazing view of table mountain. The waves are also half decent for a surf or bodyboard. However the wind does blow frequently and fierce here. It is a real kite surfers paradise.

Great beach for a picnic breakfast!. We had a lesiurely breakfast picnic here on our last day in cape town - the beach is gorgeous as are the views across to table mountain. I dont know how accessible this is without a car but if you have your own transport, definitely do it!

Lots of kite surfing fun!. This is a beautiful beach to visit. It has the best view of Table Mountain, beach, eateries, ice cream. What more can you ask for? The water was just ice cold, but not much you can do about that. Love watching the kite surfers!

If not windy - then absolutely magnificent. Bloubergstrand Beach has the most beautiful view of Table Mountain, Lion's Head and Signal Hill. The sand is white and soft and there are braai facilities available too.

Enjoying nature for FREE!. By far my highlight of our trip!! Enjoying sunset on the beach while the kids splash around in the waves. It is so beautiful with Table Mountain in the background and peaceful.

Unbeatable view of Table Mountain. As a local Capetonian, I hardly ever visit this beach as it almost guaranteed to be windy. If you're a kite surfer, this is your paradise. And if you're looking for the ultimate shot of Table Mountain, this is it. The area has great restaurants and a phenomenal sunset; as a beach - don't arrive hoping to lie in the sun and tan. You will be sandblasted.

spent Christmas morning walking along the promenade at Bougberg and it was beautiful and so peaceful.. staying at Sunset Beach made it even more wonderful as Blouberg Beach was only a 5 min drive. The kites in the sky were spectacular.

Beach chilling, look to different Kite surfers. lovely chilling on the beach well i look to my favorite sport, Kite surfers straight in front of me.If you want some lessons you can book at High Five kite school
Great view places to avoid. Please avoid doodles restaurant n bar... We had to wait 1 hour 50 mins for our mealOther than that visit other places and view is great
The view you see in movies. That classic view of Table Mountain. A must see. Legendary cold water but with a mesmerizing view. Simply stunning!
nice atmosphere. due to the reason, that you will see lot of surfers there it is a vibrant place to visit, also lots of places to eat there

Table View. Long beach what makes it easier to find a quiet spot. We were here on boxing day. Easy to park and great view on table mountain. Not the most beautiful beach, but what do you need more than water and sand.

The Authentic Table Mountain View. Very nice beach which is a Mecca for kite surfers. If you want the 'classic' photo go to the northern end of the beach where the rocks start and take your photo from there. Some great cafes and restartaunts and a nice break from the chaos of the waterfront.

Best view of Table Mountain. Bloubergstrand beach offers you the most square, and best photo opportunity of Table Mountain. Also a very nice beach for kids to play at. A must when you're in Cape Town.

Miss Green. I go here all the time. The beach is great and it has it has a lot of fun places close by so you won't get bored easily. There is a milky way at the Total garage, also a mini Mugg n Bean inside, KFC is right next door, a bunch of restaurants all around outside and a few bars. Bayside mall is also just up the road!
Bloubergstrand. A great family and social beach area with an attitude! Great views of Cape Town, top restaurants with a unique character to this part of the Western Cape.

Get some great pictures of Table Mountain!. Bloubergstrand is always a great place to visit, especially during sunset. You will get the most amazing pictures from this beach, with Table Mountain in the background. This beach has a nice walkway along the beach, as well as a lot of benches to sit on and watch the sunset. This beach is also quite popular for kitesurfing, surfing and stand up paddle boarding. There are also a few nice restaurants, like the Blue Peter Hotel (buy a cocktail and chill on the hotel's lawn while you watch the sunset) as well as Moyo's.

Long, lazy beach. We visited when there was a strong South-Easter blowing. Not the best time to spend on the beach, but heaven for kite-surfers. There were hundreds of them flying around on the waves - quite a sight to behold! Bloubergstrand is really a long stretch of sand, curving around Table Bay. You get a wonderful view of Table Mountain, Leeukop (Lion's Head) and Seinheuwel (Signal Hill). Enough restaurants to choose from, for every taste. Do try the pizzas at Blue Peter! Although you can get to Blouberg by public transport, I would recommend using your own car, so that you can explore the area.

Bloubergstrand. Always a treat! You can visit Bloubergstrand any time of year for the perfect view. We never get tired of our Table mountain, the perfect stage set for any activity. Beaches are lovely for walking, windsurfing and secluded, romantic picnics between the rocks.
The best place to see the Mountain. Bloubergstrand is the best place to look at Table Mountain. Definitely a must for all travelers that visit the Cape!

Place to see Table Mt in full view. this is a fantastic place to see the table mountain in full view, and especially in the late afternoon and early evening, you will see table mountain and cape town city with lights on. it is beautiful and it is amazing
"Quaint place". For a quite day with good restaurants close to the beach it is a well deserved visit !!! The perfect place for kite surfing at its best !!! Surfing as well !!!

The best view of TableMountain. If you want to catch the Table Mountain Cape town vibe, you have to visit Blouberg strand/beach front before sunset! Just have a picnic on the lawns or visit one of the many restaurants and wait for that magic moments as the sun moves to the horizon and dips into the sea. You can even on the promenade...and don't forget your camera!

Unsurpassed views of Table Mountain. Bloubergstrand Beach is very popular with the locals for many activities especially Kite Boarding when there is a South Easter. Tourists abound taking THE photo of the mountain. This beach is normally very clean but the south easter can be problematic. There is a lot of parking facilities and the traffic can be rather heavy especially over week ends and holiday periods. Water very cold ( Atlantic)

Exhilarating. The views of table mountain are amazing and you can walk for miles. It is often windy and the water is cold but it is still one of the best beaches in the world. We love watching the kite surfers. Plenty of parking.
My beach. Take a picnic basket and go for the day, water is icy cold, but it doesn't matter. Beaches easy to reach from the ample parking spots, view the best in the world.

Fab Views. Looking across the bay to Table Mountain is beautiful. To take this step back shows how large the mountain is and the scenery is great. Wonderful white sands and rolling waves are beautiful.

Immaculate backdrop. The beach is beautiful, long sandy stretches very good for walking, the sea is pretty cold so swimming is left to the brave or those with wetsuits but the backdrop of Devil's Peak, Table Mountain and Lions Head is unbeatable. For the more adventurous, kite surfing and paddleboarding are also options.
Windy!. Excellent view of the mountain! Very windy though, sunsets at this spot are picturesque.Spot at the Blue Peter for a drink or two, or the Primi Piatti, for sundowners.
Staying at hotel in Blouberg. Blouberg is a great place to stay. It's far enough from the hustle and bustle of the CBD and offers tranquil beaches. There are plenty shopping centers in the area.

An Excellent Stretch of Sandy Beach!. This is the place where many of the best photos of Table Mountain are taken from and it offers several miles of beautiful white sandy beaches and opportunities for swimming, surfing and kite surfing. The parking and amenities are top notch and will reward anyone who travels west of Capetown for another view of this enchanted city.

Excellent View of Table Mountain & Lovely Beach. My friend drove me here as he used to stay there with the view of the Table Mountain. One thing that strikes me the most about Cape Town is that it is filled with amazing beaches - you feet sink into the cold, soft sand & the crashing waves are simply therapeutic. In this case, you get the added bonus of having the Table Mountain right in front of you too. Gets a bit cold of course - perfect place for a date/picnic, but of course, suit up & not be like me who went there in shirt and shorts!
Just a day at the beach.... Park your car or bike, and just sit and look at the magnificant waves! Feel the power and smell the ocean. This is what God has in mind when he created the oceans...
Beautiful views of Tablemountain. The views are fantastic, the beach wonderful, nice restaurants to sit and enjoying beautiful food and wine.

Stunning. What beautiful beach. Wonderful views across the bay, sand like talc, and entertainment watching the skilled kite surfers in action.
Must watch the sunset from here, it is mind blowing.
Magic Beach. As the photo shows a super beach overlooking the grand Table Mountain. Being the Atlantic Ocean very cold for swimming although attended by many kite surfers.

This is south Africa. What's not to like about Bloubergstrand? I fell in love with it on one of my first visits to the Cape and still I love it for its fantastic view and the freedom of being by the sea on the beach - watching kite surfers perform seemingly endless miracles. It is a great place to visit, walk, smile chat and chill as long as the wind is not so fierce that it causes the sand to bite your ankles!

Best view of Table Mountain. We went to get a view of Table Mountain. It was the best view of it we had. The beach goes on and on, great to walk along. No crowds of people, just a few dog walkers. We didn't do the Robbin Island trip, but I believe you get a similar view from there. Other than the view and beach there didn't seem much to do in this area.

Best free view of Table Mountain and Cape Town!. Short drive from Cape Town which should not be missed. Lovely long beach to walk along and amazing view of Table Mountain. You could spend around an hour here just walking and taking in the sight.
Stunning. This is a stunning beach and you will see many amazing sunsets that will take your breath away. It was a pleasure watching the whales

Another Gorgeous Beach. More Diverse people, kid friendly and more waves than the other beaches....though the water is COLD. A great place for a weekend afternoon. There will be some trying to sell stuff but that's the case at many beaches.
Breathtaking ..ALL THE TIME. Can be windy but always beautiful Cocktails by the beachfront! Absolutely awesome. The clean stretch of the beach also makes for good exercise.
Table Mt View from a distance. sandy white beach with a beautiful view of Table Mountain. Awesome to run your dogs, sit and see the sunset.

THE hotspot to view the Table mountain. Not many people know about this attraction. It is the best view point to donwtown and the Table mountain. It is just 20 minutes by car from downtown. A few cafes are on the side also and parking is easy!
The best view of Table Mountain. The best view of Table Mountain and a wonderful strolling beach to enjoy, swim or just relax. Good food & drinks within walking distance.

Amazing view across the Bay and the mountain, and ovley white sand beaches and dunes. On a windy day this beach lights up in colour with wind surfers, or when the tide is right the surfers or kayaks or something always going on. Lots of restaurant's, pubs and clubs in the area, Suitable for the sporty, the lazy the kids and the young and the old.Amazing sunsets and lots of cocktail spots, Tremendous views of Robben Island .OOOh my side of town what must I say

A must see for visitors to Cape Town. Although it takes some time to get there, mostly due to road construction, it is worth the visit. Exceptional view of Table Mountain and Cape Town. When I visited it was slightly hazy, but still got some nice pics. This area is in my top five things to do in Cape Town.
Million dollar view. Bloubergstrand beaches are so beautiful , wide, open and the most beautiful view of Table mountain. Very trendy with lots of activities and a beautiful spot to enjoy and relax.

The best panorama view of table mountain. If you really want to stand back to see the complete mountain in panorama this is the place to go. Nice beach if you want, plenty to eat, it's a lazy day/part day out

Best views of Table Mountain. I regularly take groups of foreign language students on the MyCiti bus(public) to Eden on the Bay and then walk back towards Table Mountain. We stop off at Ons Huisie for dinner, there are other places but it's my best and we watch the stunning sunsets before returning home on the bus which is very safe. The temperatures are generally lower than central Cape Town and is often windy which is why it is popular with kite surfers
fabulous beach with stunning views. Bloubergstrand is a great place to stay - close to Cape Town central, good bus service into the centre of CT and stunning views over Table Mountain.

Namakwaland tour. Leaving from Cape Town with Namakwa Tours was really a trip to remember. Well organised accommodation,delicious home cooked meals.Friendly staff.Tour guide Mike,oh my so competent,well informed and a real live wire!From the first turn to Blouberg strand we stopped to look at the flowers. This is a mist do trip!
Beautiful beach with best view of table mountain. Stayed in B&B just behind the beach but couldn't resist after a long days work to have a walk at sunset. Best way to relax... :)
The Best View!. Bloubergstrand has the best view of Table Mountain and Cape Town as a whole. You can even get a clear view of Robben Island. The water is very cold though.

What a Setting!!!. There are few places in South Africa with as beautiful a setting as Bloubergstrand Beach. You see see a beach front practically from horizon to horizon! And then to top it all, you have a full frontal shot of Table Mountain in all its glory, especially on a clear day.

Awesome Beach. Lovely beach . No overcrowding . Perfect for people who don't love crowds of people . Kids love the icy cold water :-). Love the sunsets and the view of Table Mountain and Robben Island.

BEACH AND COFFEE AT IT'S BEST. An amazing beach where you can stroll for miles and miles. One of the best I have visited and just across the road from plenty coffee shops an restaurants along the road.

Scenic. This is my favourite beach as the view of Table Mountain is fantastic!
Early morning from 7am is great. Summer much better.

Best view. Such an beautiful view of Table Mountain, even on a misty day. We went early morning and spent quite a while just starting at the view and the very clear blue water. Not a beach for picking up shells but theres plenty of small rounded rocks all over.
Brilliant!. Very nice when you see the background, especially when kite-surfers are there, it's the best place in the world for kite-surving!
Very nice views. Very nice views and photo opportunities, but far out of Cape Town and you need at least 30 minutes from Cape Town CBD to get there.
Early morning beach walk!. Taking an early morning walk on the most beautiful stretch of beach in the Cape with Table Mountain views!!!
Such an amazing view. Probably the beach with the best view of Table Mountain. Definitely why I decided to propose on this amazing beach

The most amazing view of Cape Town. I had the chance to stumble upon this beach on a very sunny (and not so windy day!), This is the picture postal perfect place. The view is just amazing and at sunset it is even better.

Best beach in town. Visited on our way towards Cape Town. The Ocean is blue, the beach almost white. Great view of Cape Town in the distance. A must visit if you like white sandy beaches with a great view.

Stunningly beautiful . Went here Tuesday 22 September, beach was deserted....... apart from the odd dog walker. Lovely beach but the view of table mountain is just "jaw dropping"....... If you do go to Cape Town you must go here.

Perfect beach. On a clear day the views across to table mountain will give you the quintessential photo of table mountain (short of going to Robben island)Stunning views, clean beach - do yourself a favour and drive further down the coastal road to the Blue Peter for a few sundowners - absolulutly stunning, no where else in the world with these sunsets over the bay/ocean
Stunning!. With the tourist brouchure view you can't go wrong! When we were there the kite boarders were having a field day due to the windy conditions! Awesome!
Most beautiful views. The view of Table Mountain from the beach is amazing. A stunning beach to take the kids and enjoy a family outing building sand castles.
Post card beautiful!. A beautiful, long beach with the most famous view of Table Mountain from across the bay. Lovely for a walk with some lovely places to eat/drink.
An everyday visit. A beautiful beach with wonderful views of Table Mountain.Water very cold but access to the Island during low tide.Able to walk along the seashore for miles .

Picture perfect. On our very last day in CPT we made a massive mission (in Friday evening traffic out here for the famous 'In the Frame' picture. The hour long taxi journey at 5pm was worth it because the view looking back at CPT and Table Mountain is as good as a post card. The promenade where the frame is has loads of bars and had a fantastic pre-weekend vibe about it. All of us agreed that we would have been disappointed if we hadn't made the effort to go hang out here.

Postcard views!. Best beach to view Cape Town from the post card pictures! This beach should be renamed Selfie Beach as most everyone coming to this beach takes a selfie or 2 from this beach! Great soft sand, streches for miles. Avoid it on the south easter days (you know it is blowing when the mountain has a thin cloud over the top!) Very pet friendly as long as your dog is on a lead and you clean up after your doggies mess. Stunning sunsets over the beach and awesome little bars along the beach to enjoy watching the twinkle of the lights as dusk sets over the city.

Amazing view of Table Mountain. A must visit when in Cape Town. To me, if you are in Cape Town, and you have not visited Bloubergstrand Beach, the trip is incomplete. It is not an ideal beach to spend a day on. The reason is that it is windy. But it offers a great view of Table Mountain.... The photos taken from this beach of Table Mountain are iconic. Spend an hour or so there, and you can always eat from the restaurants nearby. Here is a link to photos of Table Mountain from BLoubergstrand: http://www.mujahidurrehman.com/galleries/landscapes/table-mountain-cape-town/

Landscapes and sunsets.. If you want to get a nice sunset with table mountain in the background this might just be the place you want to be. If you are looking for an endless walk on the beach you might want to drive out to this beach and start walking. The white sands and the chilly waters definitely smooths the soul. It's also a great beach for a family day. There is also a lot of restaurants just across the road along the beach.
Picture Perfect. Epic views of the beautiful mountain. If it even looks slightly windy, avoid it...but for photographic moments, this is the palce to be
A place to see!. Really nice beach, extremely windy but worth the view!Perfect spot for a picnic and kit surfer watching!
Beautiful!. The view of Table Mountain and Robben Eiland is amazing! Definitely one of the places to visit when coming to Cape Town!

This is one of the most beautiful beaches in Cape Town. White sands and blue seas wit Table Mountain in the background, what more can one ask for. We took a long walk along the seafront. Even though it was winter, we had some sunshine with the wind. In summer this beach is very popular. There are many, many eating places in the area. Family picnics or just an ice cream cone on the beach is an enjoyable experience for all ages.The water is a bit cold but this doesnt seem to deter the swimmers in good weather. Eden on Bay is on this sea line. Loads of places to stay in the area.
chilling experience. the sea, with the views of Table Mountain and Robben Island are priceless. this place gives you all 3 tourist attractions in one place

Blouberg Beach. Perfect for families, couples and friends. Often you can watch kite-surfers from this beach. You can get a beautiful view of Table Mountain from this beach and it is lovely to walk along.
Best Kite Surf spot in Cape Town. If you are in to Kite Surfing; this is the spot to be. Good waves and strong winds and a view like none other...

Best ever view of Table mountain. When looking for a perfect place to take a postcard picture of Table mountain, head out to Blouberg on the West coast and you will never be disappointed. White sands, blue sea all compliment the most awesome picture you will ever capture of Table mountain.
View of Table Mountain - priceless. The view of Table Mountain from across the water at Bloubergstrand is priceless. Just remember the water is quite cold so keep it in mind.
Table mountain views over the sea. Check out the best view of Table Mountain from here. This is a great beach for long dog walks. Very popular with locals

Breath taking. Having been at the top of the mountain for most of the day we decided to go for sun downers here and were totally taking in by the beauty of Cape Town great bars and Restaurants here and the view is superb. dig your feet in the soft beach sand sip a cocktail and enjoy the view this is what i call super!

Best views of Table Mountain. This wide open beach is definitely a must visit when in Cape Town. It has the BEST views of Table Mountain! Plenty eateries and pubs along the beach front. It gets busy on weekends with cyclists and runners getting their heart rates up with some exercise to families enjoying the beach. For the more adventurous types enjoy a dip in the very cold ocean. Enjoy the people watching and also the kite surfing crowd riding the waves. You won't find better views of Table Mountain anywhere!

Exhilirating and Exciting.. This beach is one of the most beautiful beaches i have seen in Cape Town.Clean and lovely sand to be found.It is so conveniently located as well.So easy for visitors to get there.A must See.

Perfect photo spot. The amazing view of complete table mountain, cape towns wonderful oceans and pubs, restaurants and shops. This Beach is one of the cleanest and a great escape from the worlds troubles. Whether its taking time out of your busy schedule to unwind and watch and listen to the waves break or taking your perfect wedding album photos creating a full cape town feel and picturesque back drop. Bloubergstrand beach is an amazing stop.
Worthwhile if you are in the area.. Best white sand beach around. Lovely area to take a walk and enjoy the different cafes and restaurants. Quite bussing on a weekend.

Another view of Heaven on Earth !. To view Table Mountain from Bouberstrand or a cruise ship entering Table bay, is one of those breathtaking experiences to lift your soul, that you will never forget! When that advice was givenj by Bernard Shaw on visiting Dobrovnic in 1929, "If you want to see heaven on earth before you die visit Dobrovnic" he had not yet visited Cape Town to experience this view that you could never forget.!
Ice cream and the sea. The water is warmer than Clifton and Camps Bay, but the sand is harder. There are lovely ice cream and food stores on the beach front.

The best view in the world. There is no view like it anywhere in the world. Cast your eyes on the stunning mountain and surround yourselves with friendly faces. Sit back and watch the kite surfers, paddleskiers and surfers out on the water. There are people kicking a ball or playing volleyball on the beach; or just sitting and enjoying the view of a spectacular Cape Town. Whether it is wet or windy, or clear and hot, you get to enjoy something slightly different every time you visit Bloubergstrand Beach. There are a number of restaurants, bars and take away places to enjoy a wide selection of foods to suit every palate from those with discerning taste buds to those fussy little eaters some of us parents have in tow. Each day you visit will be different.

Relax on the beach at Boubergstrand Beach... A lovely beach with white sand and you see Table Mountain and Robben iland. Ideal to sun tan or walk along the beach or a picnick for the family.Their is take away places or restaurants.

Amazing view of the mountain. I and two coworkers stayed in a small hotel here in November. We loved walking/running on the beach before going into work for the day. The area seemed safe enough for our runs (2 girls running together; guys on thier own) with one one even giving us a second look. We enjoyed the sound of the ocean, the breeze, and being out of town during the spring evenings.

Beautiful view. Be in Capt Town, and not be here it is a sin. Great place, beautiful view, walk for a few hours and lunch, which is a long time to remember. With family or friends, certainly much better than yourself. I would recommend!

A must do visit to Bloubergstrand Beach Cape Town South Africa. Bloubergstrand Beach, for me a real traditional beach, long and wide, although steep in terms of the angle towards the sea which suggests you would be out of your depth pretty quickly. There is a wonderful view from the beach overlooking the bay towards spectacular Cape Town City & Table Mountain. The area attracts the wind at times and is great for the wind surfers with the colouful and their photogenic foils. The beach backs on to a sand dune bank and walkways through to the easy free parking along the coast road and if your lucky you may se a sea lion on a good day.
Beautiful Blouberg. A beautiful beach with the most famous view of Table Mountain. The dunes and area around have been rather neglected though.

Great Beach. Clean and Tidy. Kite surfing and more ! This beach stretches for miles and miles and looks across to the famous Table Mountain and across to Robbin Island. A day out not to miss when not too windy. Or visit to view the Kite Surfers on a windy day!

My beautiful Cape Town. The view from this beach is awesome on a clear day. It is however very windy out that way. The water is cold and not pleasant for swimming! Good for surfing though! You are also able to view Robin Island from this point.

Best views of Table Mountain. We literary live on this beach which has the one of the best views of the mountain. It's great for long, long walks and is very popular for kite surfing, and yes, the waters cold but the view makes up for it! In summer it can get windy, but, hey, it's on the coast! You can escape the wind at Catch22 for some great sushi and a glass on wine or a Jack Black craft beer.

Seven wonders view.. The postcard perfect picture from Bloubergstrand. Now one of the seven natural wonders of the world is an amazing sight from the beautiful beaches. Kite surfing, surfing, sUP and so much more is an every day activity. Lovely restaurants to visit.

Fantastic Views. If you visit the place just for the views of Table Mountain, its worth it,
But its more than just that, it also has beautiful beaches, restaurants, and far more relaxed than Camps Bay,

One of the best views in Cape Town. Absolute bliss, peaceful and quiet with shop sand bars nearby if you feel like a eat or drink!
Dip your toes in the icy waters if you dare and feel the sand between your toesies
cool view. If you can get here, do so, the view of CT and table mountain is superb. Signs everywhere re car safety, so don't leave things on show
Bloueberg Iconic Cape Town. Miles of pure white beach, surf, windsurf, walk your dog, romantic photo, coffee, bird watching and much much more. You can every attempt a swim!!

Great beach. Brilliant beach. Too cold to swim but great to watch people do wind surfing, and beach walks. we loved the side ways available for runners and cyclists. a bunch of great restaurants, we loved moyo

Pretty beach, cold water.. Well this is the beach close to my house so obviously I'm going to think it's the best. There is a probably with wind and litter and I have to admit that the water is freezing cold but it has the best view of Table Mountain. There is a reason why it's called Blouberg (Blue Mountain in Afrikaans) and the locals fondly refer to it as Blowberg (making reference to the wind).

Pretty as a picture.... Just the view of table mountain makes this beach special! It is always forever buzzing with people walking, running, cycling or walking their dogs. It is also one of the most popular kite surfing beaches.

iconic view of Table Mountain and Cape Town. This can be a very windy part of Table Bay, but the view is spectacular. In recent decades Bloubergstrand has become much more built up than it used to be.

Table Mountain Splendour from afar. Bloubergstrand offers an amazingly different view to Table Mountain than anywhere else on the peninsula. It is stunningly beautiful and the beachfront coffee shops and restaurants are spectacular.

It is a very windy beach but the area is a very hip and trendy and the pics from there are magnificent. I will always book my accommodation there even when the area is very windy. The beach is very clean with a lot of local visitors but very safe.
Beautiful. Beautiful beach with a stunning view on Table Mountain. Nice to sit here and watch the kite surfers.
Table Mountain at it's best. A great beach although the water is freezing. The view of Table Mountain is out of this world. Probably the most viewed area for Table Mountain with the sea below.

Emblamatic Cape Town view. Pick your day. Ask a Capetonian when tat day is and enjoy the view and the clear air. Great fun places to eat not far away and if you do hit the wind take your windsurfer or hire one . Picnic on a wind free day take your sunscreen. Not far from the City center.

Best view of Table Mountain. One could cycle here from town in the cycle lane, and return with the MyCiti bus.
The perfect place for walking on the beach, searching for shells whilst enjoying a soulful conversation. Enjoy pizza and beer afterwards on the lawns at the Blue Peter hotel.

Essentially good for kyte surfers in Summer. Constant winds!. Long stretch of beaches going up to Table View. Nice place for long safe walks if you are not a kite surfer.
In winter the Atlantic wind can be very cold.

Cool sunset drinks spot. Without a doubt one of the most beautiful beaches in the country. The view towards Table Mountain is legendary and if you catch it on a windless day you are bound to have a great time. The pubs and restaurants along the main beachfront are all pretty cool and offer variety. Well worth making time for.

Chilled, Great spot to watch the kite surfers. A Kewl little pocket of restaurants/Bars/ ice cream shops to suit every pocket, lots of locals go so you know it's gotta be true. There is an amazing cheap as chips Indian restaurant, a Vipor bare for you bikers, Catch 22. 24 hour pizza so a lively little area for the not so old.

Stunning view of Table Mountain. No wonder there are so many postcard pictures of Table Mountain taken from Bloubergstrand - it is a stunning view, especially on a clear day.
It is nice to talk a walk on the beach, sometimes a bit busy with the surfers. The wind is also sometimes not too friendly and makes it challenging to walk on the beach.

Always lovely and young people around. This is the place for young, active surfers, windsurfing, kitesurfing, dog sledding and the like.
The water is COLD but the vibe is lekker!
Ice cream shops, Spur, restaurants and malls... medical centre and on the MyCiti bus line. Go spend the day there and enjoy!!!

Cold water for the soil. Nice to walk next to the beach water very cold but very nice be on the lookout for dog droppings they are allowed on the beach buy an ice cream next to the beach and enjoy the view of Table Mountain it's like food for the soil.
Buzzing beach. Clean beach with Table Mountain as the backdrop is a beautiful place to visit and relax. I am not a fan of the cold water but the scenery makes up for not swimming.

Windy View. It all depends on what type of Vista's you are in the mood for, this particular day of my visit the wind was howling at my legs with sand burn being inevitable. I did however get a glimpse at the adventurous Capetonians on their Glide/surfing taking full advantage of the wind.
Iconic View. This is the beach to visit should you want that iconic view of Table mountain.Beautiful clean beach but be warned the water can get cold.Well worth a visit though.
Bloubergstrand Beach. Nice beach and a great view of the kite surfers was fun but be prepared to be sandblasted because of the strong winds.
Best views of Table Mountain. Be sure to visit the Eden on Bay area for stunning restaurants who cater for various taste and the best views of Table Mountain!

The best view of table mountain. Wow - this is the best location for a portrait view of table mountain and the city of Cape Town. Excellent seafood restaurants in the location with plenty of other choices as well to suit all budgets.

Long golden beach with view of Table Mountain -. Loved the golden sand and crashing of the waves where you walk for miles and forget your cares - stop off at one of the many restaurants for a breakfast, lunch or dinner - a must on your travels. Smell the sea air - feel the wind in your hair and let the sand sooth your feet as you wander along picking up pebbles or little shells - a moment in time where everything stands still ....

Fantastic site!. Bloubergstrand has fantastic views of Cape Town and Table Mountain. It has long white beaches and safe to take a walk there. There are sometimes wind but the view and atmosphere is worth going to view it.
beautiful. Very beautiful place. Its a long walk pathway along the beach staring from dolphin beach to Bloubergstrand Beach
Lovely tranquil area. Exquisite view and beautfull beach. Lovely hotels and restaurants in the area with a beautiful view of table mountain

Blouberg. This whole beach area is beautiful, regardless of the weather. There are many restaurants for those who are not all that interested in the scenery. Surfing, body boarding, walks etc. Areas for children to play in the water safely, skateboard ...
Great view. Fantastic view of Table Mount, Lion's Head, and Devil's Peak. Nice clean beach, water too was cold to swim but a great place to relax and take in the scenery.

View of all views.. What a stunning view you get of the Table Mountain from Bloubergstrand. They have a stunning beach with lots of restaurants to go to. Lots of shops to go to if you not a sun seeker. On weekends you will find the beach full of wind surfers.

Get that picture perfect picture of the mountain. You can just relax on the powder white sands of the famous site of a battle between the Dutch and English many moons ago for the Cape, stroll along the beach or take that picture everyone takes of the mountain, city and ocean. To the right is the famous Robben Island.
Beautiful stroll along the beach!. What a lovely beach to stroll along. Some landmarks and fun places along the way. Ice cold water, but table mountain beauty. Loved the day at Blouberg!

A real master piece. The stretch of coast is awesome. The place is abuzz with people yet you will find a place for relaxation and to sun tan.
One of the best sections of the coat line in Cape Town.

Mornings are the Best!. Bloubergstrand beach is best appreciated in the morning when one can take in the beauty while it's peaceful and calm. It must however be said that any day is a good day for the beach. It's good for the entire family with amazing views of what the Mother City has to offer. If you love mingling, there's a great mix of people (and dogs)

Where classical pictures cannot be avoided. Just north of the Cape Town CBD lies this beach, on the edge of revitalized residential zones and Cape Town Bay. There are facilities for the beach visitors, sufficient bu not spectacularly good. From here, many classical pictures of Cape Town, Table Mountain, Lion's Head and Signal Hill are taken. You must be something of a photographic analphabete not to succeed in making the shot of your dreams. The bay water is very cold, as it is around all of the Cape Town west coast.
