Occasional sharks may also be spotted. This, after all, is the bay that prevented all but one prisoners from Robben Island to escape and reach freedom shore again ...
Beautiful. Very beautiful beach.. Lots of entertainment around the beach area, restuarants, pubs, clubs, a park and petrol station with Bonjour, and milkylane!

Beautiful. Bloubergstrand has one of the most beautiful views of Table Mountain. Just be prepared - it will always be windy and the ocean will always be very cold! Great ice cream and pizza close by.Kids and dog friendly!
Interesting!. Lovely beach, beautiful views. Lots of people milling around and activities. We were there on a photographic tour and enjoyed the scenery.
Long beach with nice sand. Just a long street along the Bloubergstrand Beach, not very romantic. Very crowded on a sunday afternoon by locals.
The Island. Take a walk across to the Island when its low tide, but make sure to get back across before hide tide comes in.

Icy, Central, Happening. Bloubergstrand is stunning for kite flying, windsurfing, surfing, paddleski'ing and running your Huskies. The people are friendly, easy to chat to and there's always something happening. There are a large variety of Restaurants in the area and just around the corner you have the ever popular Blue Peter and Ons Huisie - well worth a visit.It's close to town, on the MyCiti bus route and really great as an outing for the family and also to go walking down to Milnerton lighthouse.Squeeky Clean sand, sometimes you see wales, dolphins and seals. Look, the water is really cold - but if you're on that side of town then it's to be expected. Lekker Local spot. Close to town. Casual attire, slip slops and shorts and ice cream places. Oh yeah!
Beautiful place. Love the eatery around. All pubs and restaurants.. Love the senset. Its the best place to be around if you are a food lovers..Every place around are the best.
"The must see view". This is a must see view of Table Mountain. Also the beautiful view of Robin Island and the beautiful people and beaches.
A great view of the bay. A nice beach tow walk on- a long strip with a geat view of Cape Town city, the bay and the the mountain. It also allows dogs so quite a good space for dog lovers.
Great view of Table mountain. Coffee in the on the rocks retuarant on the beachfront, excellent service and friendly staff and a view to die for

Beauty of Blouberg.. Blouberg is amazing, the view, the sunset, the romantic atmosphere attached to this beach is astounding. Sunset on Blouberg is a must see when visiting South Africa, and it is something for all to add to their "to do list". Blouberg is a family friendly destination, with lots to do, lots to see, and restaurants in the close proximity

Undisturbed Table Mountain views . If you're a swimmer this beach is not one to write home about. The water is freezing and it tends to get quite windy.However it is ideal for kite - surfers.The best thing about the beach is the view. This is about the best place in Cape Town to get beautiful shots and views of the Table Mountain range.You can also see Robben Island in the distance.Also the sunsets are absolutely amazing. This is a beach with plenty of perks
best sunset spot. if you like to see table mountain and to get a perfect sunset spot this is the place. also the beach it self is really nice. so if you are a romantic soul this would be the place.

hidden secrets of Blouberg. In autumn the wind dies down and you get some great beach days with far less crowds.
In summer, the sun is up very early in the morning and late the evening. Do go for these times too. The sunrise in summer is great at 04h30, and the sunset at around 20h00.

Great views. Windy on the beach, water is freezing but worth a visit as it has great views of table mountain and lions head. Nice long sandy beach for a walk set in a good residential area. Stayed in the area lots of time and always felt safe to wander around.

Lazy days and sunset beach. This beach looks directly onto Table Mountain and is beautiful. You can swim but the water is cold. On Sundays the nearby Hotel opens up it's gardens and serves great light lunches. At low tide you can walk out to the rock. A great place to take a wheelchair the car park is tar right up to the beach and presents great views
Fun. Great to see all the kite surfers in action, kids playing on the beach. Hold on to your hat...it can be very windy here. Place worth a visit.

Magical sunsets. Not anywhere else in Cape Town will you experience a sunset like at Bloubergstrand Beach. Soft white sand and gentle current makes for a pleasant surf walk. Watch the sun go down and the new 7th Wonder of the world, Table Mountain is lit up.

Endless beaches and beautiful sunsets . This is one of the most magnificent views of table mountain ever. The beach is really long and very clean with fantastic jogging paths on the side! The ideal beach to practise yoga on as the sun is setting or to indulge in a gorgeous Cape wine.

Nice Beach and Great Views of Table Mountain. We stopped here on the way up to the West Coast - the beaches seem very clean and we had fun watching the kite surfers. But our main reason for stopping was to get some great pictures of Table Mountain!
Gorgeous. Gorgeous beach with a lovely mountain in the background. It is well maintained and clean. Good photo oppertunity of the mountain.

what an expanse of sand and water!. Such a large beach with Table Mountain in the background and very few kite surfers on a week-day. One gets the feeling of an endless stretch of white sand with little sea-weeds....and much invigorating wind.
Worth the 30 min drive. Stunning views, super clean sand and water, and enormous empty beach to relax on, safe area, whats not to like?!

Favourite destination. Discovered Bloubergstrand in 1972, loved the place then and still love visiting it.
Lovely ocean, beaches, rocks, views and sunsets.
Good variety of restaurants in area to suit every taste.
Not commercialised in any way, definitely my favourite destination in the world

Whitest sand ever. The beach is long and beautiful with a great view of Table Mountain.
It is a bit of a drive from Cape Town central but worth doing just to experience.
The sand was blindingly white which is amazing.

Best views of Table Mountain. It takes about 30 minutes with good traffic to drive to Bloubergstrand beach from the V&A Waterfront but it is worth the trip for the amazing views of Table Mountain, Lions Head and Downtown Cape Town. The day we visited the beach it was very windy and there were hundreds of kite surfers out in the ocean. The view was even more beautiful with hundreds of brightly colored kites soaring in the air. It was so entertaining watching many of the surfers. Some of them would catch a wave and the wind at the same time and they would become airborne and soar over the waves for several seconds. It was a great way to spend an afternoon in Cape Town.

Exceptional. Bloubergstrand Beach offers the best of both worlds. It has table mountain on the horizon and great sandy shores. It is clean, well kept and very attractive. You will be able to grab lunch or dinner just across the road since it has easy access to restaurants.
Tonie's review. Well it was very nice visiting the beach at Bloubergstrand. Me and my wife parked our car close to the beach only to be chased by a policeman

Beach with a view. Bloubergstrand Beach has exceptional views of the mountain and Robben Island. It is clean and very attractive with easy access to restuarants and places to have a meal or a sundowner - or even brunch. Love it!

Best views of Table Mountain. What a great place to sit and watch the world go by.. Great restaurants on the beach front where you can sip CHEAP cocktails or beers and watch the surfers with the most amazing backdrop.

Great if you don't want to sunbathe. This is one of the prime spots for kite surfing in Cape Town but it also has one of the best views on Table Mountain. The entire area is subject to high winds in the evening but this has never been a problem for us as most of the restaurants are only a short walk away. We love the area as it has a small town feel to it.

A windy and wonderful beach with a view of Table Mountain to die for. If you like bracing air, and long sandy beaches, Bloubergstrand is for you.Go for wind-surfing, kite-surfing, kayaking, surfing and all types of water sports. The wind can pick up suddenly, so one has to watch this, if engaging in activity sports.A good place for playing with kids, so long as you watch them near the water.

Best view of Table Mountain. A drive out to Bloubergstrand is worthwhile for the amazing view of Table Mountain from where many of the photos are taken. Often there are many people with colourful kites on the beach which makes for a great picture. Not as pretty as the beaches of Clifton or Camps Bay just long with very fine sand and plenty of room. Lots of apartments overlooking the beach and restaurants here and there.

The ultimate Kodak shot. The totally ultimate place for a romantic photo. Take someone special, take a pic at sunrise or sunset or noon. You will find this is best pic in your album. If you go late afternoon, fantastic number of kite boarders too

Superb Beach!. Looking for a different view of Table Mountain?...well this long white unspoilt beach offers just that. There is a very safe feel about it and there is a great selection of places to eat at. Its a great place to relax, but it can get very windy!
Absolute heaven!. One of the best beaches I have ever been too. Incredible views with quaint micro hotels and lovely restaurants. The people were so kind.

Go and watch the kite surfers! Great action and pix!. Highly recommended.Go to relax, sit on the beach, watch the kite surfers, swim, or kite surf yourself. Great views of Cape Town and Table Mountain in the background. Bring your camera!A number of good restaurants are in the area along the road across the street from the beach.Check it out!
No. 1. of all the beaches around Cape Town that I visited, this one is definitely my No. 1 favourite. It's also easy to be reached via public transport
Nice place.. Enjoy the sunset at this place...good people, nice vue. You Can have a drink or dinner looking the sun falling down...

Love this beach. We often go to the blue peter for sundowners and watch the sun disappear we love this beach and it is the best beach to take photographs of table mountain when it is a clear day. Lots to do here including surfing windsurfing as there is often a good wind we often used to go here just for the day with family and friend we used to be able to break on the beach but unfortunately you are no longer able to do this but it is still fun beach and big enough to find a space to sit in peace if you just want to read...

A unique experience. We went to Bloubergstrand beach to get the view of Table mountain, unfortunately it was very misty but we were treated to the sight of 10 beautiful race horses being given a swim and then a roll in the sand. The wild sea the fog and the horses gave us an amazing photo op!

Postcard view of Table Mountain. This is my stomping ground so I'lol going to have to try to summarize coz there's soooo much to say. To get there turn off of the R27 at the Dolfin Beach Hotel and drive to the information centre carpark. Most days there are hundreds of kite surfers - there is Kite Surfing lessons and kit hire across the road. anywhere along Blouberg beach is THE best angle to photograph Table Mountain. There are restaurants across the road if you need to eat but I suggest you drive further(about another 2km - it's signposted) to Eden on the Bay at Blouberg's Big Bay. At Eden there is one of those Yellow frames with the gps coordinates through which you can take a shot of the mountain. Big Bay has surf board and wetsuit rentals if that is your thing - the waves can get big but there are plenty of days for a novice to try their hand at surfing. All along the road to Eden and at Eden itself are eateries of varying descriptions - all the food is yummy so there's no one that stands out for me. The beaches are clean, ablutions are dotted all along the Blouberg coast - some of them are locked because they were being used as sleeping quarters for vagrants and hangouts for druggies (urghhh) but the ones at the main beaches are kept open and safe. The best swimming beaches are Small Bay, the Beach opposite The Blue Peter and the beach at Big Bay - the lifesavers clubhouse is at Big Bay. Swimming elsewhere could be dangerous unless you are a very good swimmer because of strong currents. When you park your car don't leave anything valuable visible in the car - that will just invite an opportunistic thief to break into your car. There are usually mounted and motorized police patrolling the entire beachfront to keep the area safe.

Rolling views. The beach and the views are just awesome,the beaches are clean , and you can take your umbrella ,chairs and just sit in the sun, there are also various sports, cycling rollerblade, walking , and of course eating
A day at Bloubergstrand Beach. The scenery and many restaurants to choose from. If people watching is your thing this is the place to be.
Beutifull views. Despite the cold water it is a very nice place to view Table Mountain and table bay and the perfect place to enjoy a sun downer.

Best views of Table Mountain and sandy shores. If you are looking for the picture postcard photo of Table Mountain then this is your beach!
Clean beaches which run for miles from Blouberg with different points of interest along the way.
Adacent to Bloubergstrand there are plenty of restaurants and bars as well as ice cream shops to sit and oogle at the view.

Best Views of the Mountain. If you want to get the best views / pictures of Table Mountian this is the place to go. The beach is situated across the sea from Table Mountain and on a clear day the view is simple stunning. I have taken many memorable photos from here and everyone who sees them agrees they are beautiful. The beach is quiet and does not have many shops / places to eat, unless you walk further away from table mountain.

Amazing view, but not much else. You can take a trip to Blousbergstrand, but it's not usually for the beach. There are heaps of great restaurants in the area and most of them offer amazing happy hours and stunning views of Table Mountain. When the wind isn't very strong, it's also very nice to run along the beach, or even walk your dog.

Wonderful views. Great beach in a rather ordinary area, popular for surfing, and kite surfing, which we found fascinating to watch. Just a short but pleasant drive out of town, but the views are to die for.

Probably the best view in the world.. Table View and Bloubergstrand have lovely white fine beaches, the sea is a lovely shade of blues used extensively by kite surfers. The view of Table Mountain and Cape Town is superb from here second to none in the world.Don't miss it if you visit Cape Town.

Overrated. Yes it's a nice beach but I really don't understand the hype around it. The view is nice, you can take your official Cape Town picture here but that's pretty much it. Restaurants are overpriced at the beach and when I walked around in the sand I had to dodge so much trash that it really wasn't fun anymore.
Excellent kite surf venue. Just happened to be there while about a hundred people trained with their kites for an ongoing competition ending on February 14

What a windy beach. The view outstanding - the kite surfers in their hundreds ! Wow
Great place to visit - nice Restaurants everywhere

Long beaches and beautiful view to CPT. Beautiful long and white beaches and a spectacular view to Cape Town and Table Mountain. When I was there the beaches were empty most of the time. A pity is, that the ocean is always so cold, that you barely can go to the water to swim (at least not me lol). The drive to Blouberg Strand takes about 30 minutes from the center of Cape Town, easly reachable by Uber taxi or Mycity bus.
great day on the beach. great if you like (or like to watch) kite surfing. The sea is cold not too good for swimming. avery chilled atmosphere
Best views of Table Mountain. By far the best place to get a good view of Table Mountain, particularly at sunset. A short and easy drive along the coast from Cape Town

Beautiful Beach!. Very windy beach (great for kite surfers). We didn't stay long the day we were there as the sand was kicking up...and the water is cold! Great area with nice restaurants across the road.
Beautiful beach. Clean beach, except for the weekends not busy at all. Great view on Robben Island and Table Mountain. Lots of restaurants nearby.

THE place for your holiday snaps. You have all seen the pictures from Bloubergstrand of Cape Town and Table Mountain. This is the spot for the keen photographer.The beach itself is absolutely beautiful. It stretches for miles with soft fine white sand. The day we were there it was quite windy, so not a day for sunbathing, a great day for wind surfing. I counted over 30 windsurfers along the beach at the one time. Beats people watching at the waterfront.

great photos. It is a brilliant place to go and take photos with Table montai in the backdrop. The area though is a bit downmarket, in spite of lots of newbuilds so not many nice cafes/restaurants to stop by. I would go just for photos. Also the beach is not very clean.
A beach with a view. Lovely place with great views of Cape Town and Table Mountain. Had a few drinks in the sunshine at the Blue Peter which was a nice change from a grey Manchester Airport.

What views!. I was fortunate to stay just a few minutes' walk from the Strand and Beach, so walked along there most days, both by day and at sunset. The Strand is a wide walkway, used by joggers, walkers, cyclists, dog walkers, indeed everybody - young and old. The beach is easily reached by means of gaps in the fencing and wooden slatted pathways, and the sand is soft and warm - ideal just to sit and look out to Table Mountain to the left and Robben Island to the right. It's quite breezy along there, which makes it ideal for kite surfing and surfboarding, both great to watch. There's a kite surfing school just up the way. By day it's lovely - felt very safe - and at sunset it's just superb. There are plenty of eating and drinking places just across the main road. I yearn to return.
Yes Yes Yes!. We stayed in Bloubergstrand and it was around 20 minute drive into the center. It was very peaceful but still close enough to do everything!! Sea was very cold!!
Beach Beach n More Beaches !!. it is amazing all the different beaches in Cape Town have something or the other to tell, icy waters do not stop holiday makers from getting into the water

Beautiful beach for surfing; great views of Table Mtn!. Well worth the short drive out here just for the beautiful views of Cape Town and Table Mountain. Felt less crowded than some of the other beaches, like Camps Bay. Great for surfing and walking as well.

Gentle walk on the beach. The beach walk is a must for all visitors to Cape Town. The views across the bay of Table mountain is a photo opportunity every few seconds.
For the more active there is Wind surfing and some days the wind is howling so pick your day well.

The Place to View Table Mountain from a Distance. Blouberg has a great beach with lots of restaurants along the beach which allow you to look at the view of table mountain from afar. Its absolutely, awesome, and there are also kite surfers to watch all day.Its a great place to relax and get a feel of Cape Town, watch runners come past and have a chill. Its bit out of the way though and not the best neighbor hood and does not have the dramatic scenery of Clifton or Houtbay.

Beauitful beach. Just outside Cape Town, lovely clear white sand. Ideal for walks or swiming. As the name suggests it can be very wild and uncomfortable on a windy day as the sand can blow right onto the road.
Kite paradise. Best place fore kiting, great beach nice people and good food. I visit this place 4 timers a year but the Dec-Feb period is the best..

Great walking spot/ kite surfing. We are not kite surfers but it was incredible walking the beach watching the kite surfers. Restaurants nearby leave a lot to be desired, but the beach is a relaxed and never busy.

Serious view, serious wind.... If you've ever seen a panoramic photo of Table Mountain then the chances are that it was taken from Blouberg beach.You'll want to come here just to soak up the view and it's an easy enough place to get to.You won't want to swim in the sea as the waves and surf are quite fresh and the wind can make a beach visit a short affair. There are many better beaches in Cape Town for a picnic.It gets an "Excellent" 5 points because you can't come to Cape Town without going up the Mountain and there's no better view of the mountain than from Blouberg.We always enjoy an ice cream when we visit...especially when we're tormenting our European friends in December when they're up to their knees in freezing snow.

Best View. It's a place of great awesome, to see the city from across the waters. The beach has been well maintained by the local municipality indeed. On a summer's evening, there is nothing more relaxing and greater than to go here and stroll on the beach. Walking along the shore and absorbing all the beauty. It is also the perfect location to catch a few semi-good waves but mostly for kite surfers though.Or catching a good tan in peace and quiet. Dog friendly as well, so you can bring your pooch along to enjoy the waves with you! Parking isn't much of a problem, you'll just have to find one along the beach stretch. The ones closest to the local shops like Steers, Primi, Pakalolo, etc are always the first to go. Havent seen lifegaurds on duty, so swimming is not recommended - in any case the water temperatures are really freezing out here.

Best view. For that one iconic photo of Table Mountain, Bloubergstrand is the place to go! It also happens to be a beautiful, clean and very nice beach, even if sometimes very windy. Lots of great restaurants etc, nearby.
paradise. absolute stunning beach with view towards table mountain, loads of surf kiting going on but very choppy sea.
Love this beach.. relaxed and welcoming, love this beach, whether to swim, sunbath or just take the dog for day, its a great beach to visit.
Kitesurfing madness. Blouberg strand is quite an unique experience , this is the kitesurfing central in Cape Town one of your top ten travel destinations in the world.
A great vibe. It's a lovely place to chill with either the family or as a couple. The beach is clean and further a long at Big Bay there are a lot of trendy restaurants to get a good meal.

What a view !!. Blouberg beach is fantastic, the view over Cape Town city and the table mountain is stunning. The beach is a long stretch of white sand, not too busy, perfect for a picnic or to relax. Could be very windy though !! Plenty of surfers and coffee / bar to relax behind the beach. A must to see !!
Trendy. Quite cosmopolitan very trendy beach resort mainly for younger people kite surfing in abundance and plenty drinking and restaurant bars

perfect view of table mountain. perfect view of table mountain from here.
not the best of beach atmosphere though, with lots of pubs, restaurants, ice cream parlous etc.
The view of the mountain. The best view of the iconic Table Mountain and also Robin Island. Beautiful beach, good restaurants - a nice place to relax

Best View in the World. You have got from here a picture postcard view of Cape Town with Tablemountain. The beach is clean, but the water cold. With the rigth wind you can see many Kite Surfers. Many restaurants in the surroundings round the day of.
Lovely for long walks. This is a great beach to spend the day on. You can go for long walks followed by a lovely (yet cold) swim and then have lunch at a restaurant closeby.
Fantastic Beach House. We lived at the beach, two houses next to the Blue Peter Restaurant. It was the best place. Perfect location and if you have seen your first sun downer...you know why.

Perfect Location. Beautiful Beaches, Small Shopping Mall, Amazing selection of Restaurants. The View is absolutely amazing. Definitely a perfect spot for Active People. There's a lot of Ocean and Beach Activities. Very well situated, and perfect to explore the rest of Cape Town.We stayed in Beach Front Apartments, and we could easily access the beach, mall and restaurant. The bus stop is adjacent to the Mall.
Nice beaches. About 1/2 hour from Central Cape. Beaches are clean with white sands. Downside is the the cold water of the Atlantic Ocean

Beautiful. It was a short visit to this place. Amazing beach side and beautiful scenery around. Me and my kids enjoyed a lot especially the water is very clean and clear so you can have a nice swim. But be careful don't go deep and don't let your kids go. Its amazing place so enjoy your trip. Definitely recommended.
Views to die for. With golden beaches and awesome views of Table Mountain this beach must be one of the most beautiful in the world. Would like to own a house there!
Great beach. Great views. Great beach for water sport (surfing, kite surfing etc,) Great beach for cycling and jogging. Gets windy in the afternoon.

Out of the way, but fab views. We normally head here for a walk down the beach & savour the views of table mountain.Park at Eden at Big Bay (big pick n pay supermarket car park) then head left down the beach to the news cafe about 3km away; watch the kite surfers, enjoy the turquoise sea & the white sand sparsely populated by the locals, watch the shipping containers with a back drop of table mountain.We really love it.

Best mountain views in Cape Town!. A photographer and kite surfers dream! We live in Bloubergstrand and it is just gorgeous! It can get quite windy, especially in summer, so be aware of that, but beach walks at sunset is just magic!
Beach & Restaurants. Beach and the food. No need to book ahead,within period -Beach and food. No need to book, just walk in, waiting period 30 to 45 minutes, worthwhile wait

Beautiful view. This is the beach where you get the perfect view of Cape Town. The only negative thing is that you can have a very windy day on the beach, because it is so open. Also you find the Blue Peter hotel opposite, which makes it a good choice for a drink or something to bite.

Great views of Table Mountain. We stopped here for lunch en route from Cape Town international airport to Paternoster. We chose it just for the view across the bay to Table Mountain. We weren't disappointed, it really is awe inspiring & to boot we enjoyed a great lunch at Petit Fours.

Great for a post card photo. This is the best spot to take a photo of Cape Town with the sea in front and Table Mountain as a back drop. The best thing to do is cycle from the city on the cycle paths to Bloubergstrand and have something to eat or drink at On The Rocks and cycle back. If you are tired, you can take the MiCiti bus back with your bike.
Best view in Cape Town. A variety of restaurants to choose from. Shopping malls with variety of shops. Beautiful view of Table Mountain.Can be a bit windy.

Best view in the world. You'll never forget this view of Table Mountain, with or without its tablecloth. Plenty of eating and drinking opportunities. Watch the surfers, kite surfers, paddle boarders, in fact if it's a new sea sport it'll be tested here.

Best beach spot. The beach is never over crowded and there are lots of outdoor activities like kite surfing. Or you can just sit on the beach and enjoy an ice-cream while taking in the sights. There are several restaurants that you can you sit back and enjoy a few drinks, pizza or sunset cocktails.

Nice beach to go have a walk on. The view of Cape Town and Table Mountain from Blouberg beach is awesome. Nice beach to go have a sunset walk on, or just to go play with your dog. Temperature of water is icy cold so would not recommend planning a day at the beach there unless it is really hot in Cape Town.
The best spot to see Table Mountain. Go here for excellent photo's especially for Sunset. If you drive a bit further you have a special sunset viewing area car park. Got some wonderful shots here.
Stunning. Well worth a trip here - whether it be for Sundowners or just a walk along the beach.It can get windy.

Table Mountain View. The best view of Table Mountain is from the Bloubergstrand Beaches. The Beaches are very clean and sufficient play areas for the smaller children. No Braai / Barbeque facilities available but i think without that facilities there the beach will stay clean and safe.

Awesome Views. Easily reached via Myciti bus, either from the waterfront or Civic Centre take the T01 to Table View where you will be directed to take the next bus to Big Bay. On the Front are an array of good restaurants, a large beach with kite surfers galore and a large yellow framework where you can take a photo with Table Mountain as a back drop. Allow plenty of time say a least half a day if you can spare it.

so versatile and still unspoilt. We often used to visit Blouberg beach front when we lived in the Northern Suburbs. The eventuality was we came to live here 12 yrs ago, The walks on the Beach front are fantastic. The surrounding areas are beautiful. The cafes and restaurants are varied and boast some of the most magnificent views in South Africa. Excellent coffee shops and great coffee...Carluccis, Eden Cafe and Izabellas have super coffee... There is still an unspoilt feeling surrounding the Beach front area from the initial beach front right through to Big Bay.. All types of waterss ports are available including a great following with the Kite surfing community. We urge you to visit and experience this fabulous venue.

windy but worth a visit. kite surfers paradise! this beach has a blue flag status and it is a must visit if you love to kite surf or if you like to watch the energetic bunch surfing! a spectacular setting with Table Mountain in the back.
Great walk & view, waters a smidge cold. Lovely place to walk & play on a sunny day. Water is a bit cold for swimming though. (But the surfers seemed to enjoy it)

Beautiful Blouberg!. We live here and have this sight on a daily basis, there is no other place quite like it. That mountain and the sea are such a source of pleasure and the scenery is absolutely fbeautiful and best of all - free. On a beautiful sunny day its as if we are living in paradise. The weather is ever changing here so no 2 days are the same, what fun!

Iconic early morning views. We went to this beach to photograph Table Mountain at sunrise. The view is iconic and has inspired artists and photographers alike. The morning we went did not disappoint. The views and photos we took were wonderful.

lived in this area. We actually lived for 5 years in Blouberg when we relocated to Cape Town. This area is something else as you do not feel that you are in the Western Cape. It is clean, beautiful beach although the water is cold. Lovely places to visit. Not crowded. They calls this area the playground of the rich and famous. Love it
Lovely big beach. Beautiful beach with amazing views of Table Mountain and very picturesque at sunset. Nice restaurants nearby too

For the iconic view of Table Mountain, this is where you go. I love visiting the restaurants on the waters edge. Some days the view of our beloved mountain is spectacular. Bring your camera along. Remember a few hundred other tourists will do the same. expect heavy traffic.

Sun, beach, Table Mountain view!. One of my favourite places on beautiful sunny days! With a stunning view on Table mountain. And when you have a wind-still day it is just perfect.And on windy days you have loads of entertainment with all the kite-surfers playing around.Will always be one of my favourite places!

A view from my window. One of the first things I saw from my bedroom window was the Magnificent Table Mountain in all its beauty accompanied y the sound of the waves crashing upon the pristine beaches of Blouberg strand. This un-crowded beach close to all amenities is the ideal place to have a swim in the ocean or get that tan that all holiday-makers to Cape Town need to take home with them!!!!

Loooong Walks.... My favorite bit about Blouberg is the long beach. You can walk all the way from the Dolphin Beach hotel to Eden on The Bay. Give it a try. Then stop off at Eden on The Bay and have a nice lunch and walk back again. In summer the area near the Dolphin Beach hotel is packed with kite surfers and it is amazing to watch these people do their thing. And dont forget the stunning view of Table Mountain from the beach. Robben Island is also in sight and it feels like you can swim over ;)
Stunning Blouberg. Stunning view with all the other amenities withing walking distance. The best view of Cape Town. Really commendable.
Iconic!. The best beach with the best view in SA! Pure white sand, blue sea, Robben Island feels within touching distance and of course, the view of Table Mountain is spectacular.

World Class Kitesurfing Beaches. Blouberg Beach is renowned as one of the World's best kitesurfing beaches. During the summer season, you are likely to see an array of the best kite surfers in the World in action. There are plenty of Kitesurfing schools in the area for you to try the sport as well.

Beach with many moods. Everyone knows.. to get that perfect "Cape Town" photo with Table Mountain being the focus, you come to Blouberg.It's the beach with many moods - I LOVE sitting on this beach and just absorbing what is happening. It is a beautiful stretch of beach, perfect for kite-boarding!! Great areas for kids to play in rock pools or walking - dogs allowed (on leashes). In Summer it's packed with visitors from all over the world.. always busy with kite boarders. There are rocky areas but spots where one can surf or body board as well. The beach is kept clean. Beautiful spot if you want that perfect Cape Town photo - you can capture awesome sunsets here as the sun goes down over Robben Island.So for the photographer's out there - you want to capture the mountain, Robben Island, sunsets, sometimes whales/seals, gulls, watersport or kites.. this is THE spot to be!

Nothing better!!. Went for a walk on Spring day, was the very best weather we could have asked for, sunny, clear blue sky, and the view of Table mountain from Bloubergstrand Beach, the beach is clean and well maintained. Keep it up!

Loving Bloubergstrand Beach. This must be one of the most beautiful places in Cape Town. It is very, very windy- all the time, making it ideal for kite surfers. I love this spot for the white sand and blue water. The ocean here is spectacular and the view amazing. One of the nicest spots to view Table Mountain from a different angle. Some nice restaurants located in Blouberg and not too far from Cape Town city center.

classic view of Table mountain. a half hours' drive from the city centre./.on the mi city tableview bus route. there is a small waterfront area with a number of restaurants. A popular beach for surfers and kiteboarders.

Take a mile long walk. This must be one of the longest beaches with clean sand and exceptional views. I enjoy taking a stroll from Blouberg beach toward Milnerton, seeing Table Mountain, enjoying the sound and smell of the ocean, and drawing energy from one of the most spectacular natural environments. Wind free mornings are my best. Afternoons can be windy and very hot in summer. Have fun and re-energize (for free)!

The best beach in Cape Town. the views the setting the feel of holiday and always so laid back.
Lots of restaurants etc
Selection of foods available, kite surfing, beach walking and the sea.

Fantastic views, beautiful beach. Just off the main road going North, it's worth making the detour to admire the panorama of Cape Town and Table Mountain. No matter what camera you have, people will think you're a professional photographer: white beach, deep blue sea, Table Mountain radiant against a blue sky...it doesn't come any better...and it's free!
Great views of the entire Cape Town. Worth the visit to see all of Table Mountain behind the City of Cape Town. Sunset is a particular nice time of day to photograph across the bay.

Blouberg!. The best the Cape has to offer. The view from Table Mountain is awesome. Lots of kite surfers who change the blue sky into a multi coloured rainbow. A definite place to visit is Blue Peter. And a long walk along the beach during sunset makes picture perfect memories!

Decent view, decent beach.... Yes the beach is a lovely white sand. yes the distant view of CapeTown and Table Mountain is good. But it's a fair way out and the view isn't THAT good, hence my average rating. It was just pleasant...

Beautiful. Lived in Bloubergstrand for a year and just loved it. The beach has a perfect view of Table Mountain, is easy to access, and gorgeous water. As others have said, the Blue Peter is a lot of fun for sundowners- kind of a dive hotel with a great bar. The only negative is that Bloubergstrand is a bit isolated from the rest of Cape Town, so once you're there, there's not much else to do.
Fantastic iconic view. Lovely beach with the iconic view of Cape Town. My daughter had the privilege of living here on her gap year and loved this beach, summer and winter.

no penguins :(. we visited this beach to experince and play up and close with Penguins. but to our diappointment we just saw them hiding in the bushes here and there. none of them in the beach on the water. May be it was cold for them. beach is nice with big boulders.

Best view in the world. Postcard perfect. Looks like the mountain has been painted onto the horizon. Better than Camps Bay A lovely uninterrupted view. Visit the Blue Peter for a great pizza and On The Rocks for a lovely lunch or dinner.Ons Huise is a lovely iconic restaurant but no fireplace so best enjoyed in summer.

Adopt an attitude accepting the vagaries of the weather. Children very very interesting for young children collect shellsMy Citi bus now has this beach on it's route what a blessing My view is enjoy the far stretching white beach enjoy the wind enjoy when cold weather prevails ============= Some dance in the rain others simply get wetGood views but I do not rate that as very important Carpe Diem for me because my daughter of 6 years was elated excited and enjoyed looking for shells on this lovely beach

Beautiful beaches and stunning views. A 'must visit' for every traveller to Cape Town, South Africa!
The beaches are beautiful with stunning views of Table Mountain, amazing selection of restaurants, pubs, hotels, guest houses and much, much more.
Let me show you around....

a blue flag beach. no dislike s here . i love this beach .be advise that a 3 mm wet suite will keep u warm in cold water.or stay out of the water during winter .a clean sandy beach. there is cameras to keep you and your belonging safe, a good place to do all your water activity ,

the view of table mountain is fabulous. the beaches in the north are more exposed for the wind but lovely to take long walks along and the views of table mountain is fabulous. dogs are welcome here and usually there is enough space for every one. crowded on weekends
Go for a walk!. No crowds and wide open spaces. Can walk the beach right to Melkbosstrand. Dog friendly, as long as you clean up after your dogs. Beautiful sunsets.

A long beach great for walks or windsurfing. Just north of the city this long & wide beach is great for long walks or windsurfing. (Not all areas along Cape Town waterfront has bathing or accessible beaches & many are very rocky for walking alongside only.)
Nice view. Very nice view, with marvelous sunsets. There are numerous bars and restaurants from where you can enjoy it. Cape Town and the table mountain on the background are faboulous

Best view of Table Mountain. Bloomberg is not longer inaccessible by public transport thanks to myciti bus. Travelling by car go on the N1 from the CBD and look for the turn off for Milnerton. Follow the road all the way down Milnerton, Table View until you see the signs for Bloubergstand. On a nice day it's offers outstanding views of table Mountain - not to be missed.

Great view of table mountain. With the mountain in full view and the long, pristine, white sandy beach you will struggle to find a more beautiful beach setting.In summer Cape Town is plagued by a strong South Easterly wind aptly named 'the Cape Doctor' as it sweeps any smog out to sea. This makes the beach sand blow around your legs and it can sting. Avoid in strong wind but make sure you plan a visit. Truly one of the Capes gems and not to be missed.
Beautiful. Great view of Table Mountain, nice location. I would return here is warmer weather. It was a bit windy.

The Beach where you always like to be. Bloubergstrand Beach is a wide and sandy beach. Moist of the times there is a lot of wind, but with the high temperatures that's no problem. On a clear day you have a wonderful view on Cape Town and Table Mountain.Once you have been there, you always wanna stay and if you left, you like to return as soon as possible.

love this place. We are staying on the beach front and love this place it is winter and still a great place to stay and visit. Away from the hustle and bustle of the city and close enough to get around to all the major attractions. I would recommend for families with small children they love it here too. Not good for swimming but great views and nice walks.

THE BLUE PETER IS A JOL. The beaches are stunning, DO NOT attempt to swim as it is freezing cold. the view of table mountain is superb. U have to have drinks & maybe a bite to eat at the Blue Peter - legendary!

Always go there when I am in town. Bloubergstrand is synonym with Cape Town. I always go there to look at the Mountain and some meal. When I have work colleagues I take them to enjoy one if our most beautiful sites in SA.
Best sunset .... Go there and take champagne with you, sit down somewhere and watch the sun set, the most wonderful place in this area,

Spectacular views. This is without a doubt one of the best spots for a great view of Table Mountain (on a clear day of course). I enjoyed watching the kite surfers and families walking their dogs while taking a leisurely jog down the seaside. I found the beach and environment to be safe.

best view of Table Mountain. for the best view of Table Mountain, Robben Island and Table Bay, head to Bloubergstrand Beach and enjoy some sun bathing, swimming for the brave, and a lovely meal or sundowner overlooking Cape Town!

Panorama of Cape Town. We were recommended to go here if we wanted to see the full panorama of Cape Town from land. We decided to go here for sunset and were not disappointed. We had a spectacular view over the bay and Table Mountain on the background and the setting sun gave it a magical feeling.

Top Location. We had a few hours to kill in Cape Town and with typical winter weather we decided to take a drive to Blouberg strand.We spent some time watching the waves with a perfect view of Table Mountain in the background.Despite the weather we enjoyed the time. It is strongly recommended to visit this location for the perfect view of Table Mountain.

the best view of Table Mountain. Amazing view of the mountain long sandy beach take your own deckchairs and umbrellas. Plenty of restaurant choices opposite the beach, no facilities or food outlets on the beach, Fabulous for windsurfing, and talent spotting. Can be very windy, icy waters
Stunning Beach, Great View!. Lovely beach with great views across Table bay to the Mountain! Nice choice of eating places around too.
great views and great beach. lovely beach and very popular with kite surfers. good view of Table mountain. beach goes on for miles and is in pristine condition

Great View of Cape Town. Our first stop upon arrival in Cape Town was by road from the North, and Blaauwberg Beach was it. What a great place to see the Cape Town skyline set against Table Mountian. The beach was wide and inviting. The strand walk was lined with shops and cafes to make it a memorable experience. Tourist information at the beach. Wi-fi seemingly everywhere.

Some of the best photo opportunities around. It's a busy beach in summer but it's always worth a visit; even early morning strolls or late afternoon walks are a treat. If you are looking for a photo of Table Mountain this is a very good spot to take it from. Robben Island is visible from here. If you enjoy surfing, kite surfing or stand-up paddling, you will find good company here. Be warned though, the water is icy. All year round.
Great views.. Fantastic views of Table Mountain, do not forget your camera. Beach is outstanding and is only a short drive from the city.
Lovely Place to be in. There are a lot of places available to stay in Bloubergstrand, and it is well connected via the myciti bus service to the main part of Cape Town. The beaches are excellent
Wow, such an amazing scenery!. You have to make a stop at this beach and watch the huge waves crashing onto the shore, with Cape Town and Table Mountain in the background! It is an amazing sight!

Nice views of Table Mountain. The beach has a nice infrastructure and a nice neighborhood. Unfortunately I've been there on a cloudy day, but I am sure the views of Table Mountain should be amazing. It seems to be a little out of the track for mass tourism.

Ultimate views. A short drive north of the city, gets you to the beaches and the best views of Table Top Mountain and the city. There are beach side car parks, toilets and changing facilities. Be aware of personal security here, never leave anything valuable as there are always opportunists, accept this and enjoy the beaches. I would recommend visiting early morning as the light on the mountain and city is stunning.

Great beach for all types of surfers.. The weather in February can be warm to hot but it takes a brave person to go into the water without a wetsuit. The water is the coldest I have ever experienced numbing would be a good description. Then again this beach, Big Bay and Camps Bay are more popular with the surfers than swimmers. To walk along, sit and sunbathe on super. Not far from any beach you will also find plenty of places to quench your thirst or enjoy a meal at very reasonable prices.
Beautiful white sandy beaches. Great place to take pictures and film of Table Mountain and the City. It does tend to get very windy over that side of the Bay

Postcard-worthy shots of Table Mountain. Quiet, peaceful Blouberg Beach is about half an hour's drive from Cape Town and has the same powdery white sand as its more famous siblings, Clifton Bay and Camps Bay beaches, only less crowded. From here beautiful pictures of Table Mountain can be taken and it's an amazing sensation to suntan on the beach while gazing at the mountains.

Another world. Bloubergstrand beach is less than an hour from Cape Town, but feels like a different world - it felt more like Namibia than SA. It is on the Atlantic seaboard so too cold to swim, but nice beaches to sit and enjoy the view. Just a bit North are some nature conservation beaches that are also worth a visit. We had coffee at Petit Fours on the beachfront - quaint little restaurant with some excellent coffee.

Well worth a visit. We visited this beach just north of Cape Town on a weekday when it was fairly deserted expect for about a dozen kite surfers. They were taking advantage of the strong wind and great swells.The beach looked clean and falls sharply into the sea.
Breath taking. Breath taking views of the mountains, wonderful beach, was lovely strolling along the beach in the lovely warm sand, would never get tired of the views

Picture perfect. This is where they take the postcard pictures. You can see the mountain in all it's glory. Understand why the area underneath is called the "City Bowl". See what the 2010 Soccer World Cup hype was about with the new stadium. Ample parking, great ice cream, kite surfing, walking, many restaurants and one of the best sunsets in Africa.

We never get tired of this view. I never feel I have really been to Cape Town until I go out to Bloubergstrand to see the mountain from that side of town. A wonderful, iconic view and a lovely beach to visit. Old style ice-cream sellers with their bicycles add to the charm.

a dream in Blue with a view to the table mountain. Where do you find as a European guy empty beaches, endless sand beaches which one of the most stunning views in this worlds - directly to the table mountain?And these beaches are totally empty - even in summer during week days - and 30 minutes from downtown Cape Town away!
Fab views of Table Mountain. Well worth the drive out to see the mountain . The beach is mile after mile of fabulous sand. Found a nice little bar set back from the beach and just enjoyed the view

Always impresses. We returned to the beach again, two years later, and soaked up the atmosphere. A lovely sunset but a bit windy. A few Guinness and a pizza at Doodles across the road to end our 1st day in Cape Town. Take your trainers and run or walk the promenade.
Amazing!. Make sure to visit cafe Eden and saint restaurant - two brilliant places!! Spend a day on the beach and view table mountain. My favourite place!
Relax. One of the many beaches in Cape Town, a bit windy at times but has a perfect view of table mountain from a distance

Amazing beach views. For us it was the end of a wonderful 3 weeks journey (two of them with a car), that started at Livingstone, Zabmia and was about to end a few hours later. Amazing beach with powerful waves. A good place to say good bye to the beautiful beaches of the Cape Town area.
Until we meet again....
No other view like this. Love Blouberg... The kite surfers, the clean beach, the restaurants close by, the ice-cream at the corner, the paved walking lanes...will be back.

Breathtaking views, great food and beach. Great selection of restaurants and shops on the boardwalk, with fantastic views of Robben Island, Table Mountain and the constant surfskiing, kite surfing & surfing activities. "Karoo Cattle and Land" Restaurant served some of the best food we have ever enjoyed!

Therapeutic. The view from Bloubergstand overlooking Table Mountain and the many kites is certainly a photographers dream and very soothing to the eye.Up and coming Big Bay waterfront with many spots to enjoy a sundowner and beautiful views.

Or, the windy city?. This is a para boarder or surfers dream place and we were amazed how young they start surfing here. It was very windy in each of the 3 occasions we visited but do not be fooled, you do need your sun screen for despite the cooler air, the sun is fierce! We spent several happy hours just watching the activity in e sea and people watching in general. Do not be in a hurry for food and drink from any of the beach-side cafe's for there is. I rush about any of them. I did manage to get food poisoning from one of the bars from a dodgy prawn cocktail so beware what you order!

View and food. Fantastic views of table mountain a photographers dream we went to a resteraunt called blue peter the food and staff were great made to feel really welcome,the food excellent,and the views are great,walk along the beach and watch the kite surfers,some of the tricks they do are awesome,if in Cape Town you must visit.

Lets fly. This is a great open expanse of beach with a great view of Table Mountain. We spent some time there flying our board kite with no-one to bother us. Only downside is that there is not much choice on where to eat.

amazing view to cape town, but thats it. the view on to cape town and the table mountain is one of the most beautiful views you can get on to capetown. the beach itself is nothing i´d choose for my beach day though. its nice...but nothing compared to the beaches on the garden route

Best Classic Views. Good place to visit along this shoreline giving unrivaled & spectacular classic views of Table Mountain. Also a brilliant place to park & watch the kite surfers.....& see the offshore activities of the commercial port as all the container ships & freighters wait to offload/load.....gives endless photo opportunities with combinations of sports activities with Table Mountain as the backdrop. Plenty of restaurants to chose from in the area be it snack, casual or fine dining you can find it in the area.
Nice place to visit. It is a an average beach to visit, but it is nice to have a walk along the paths and visit a cafe for lunch.
Great views of Table Mountain. Clean, beautiful beach with white sand and great views of Table Mountain and the city bowl. Bloubergstand is a mere 15 minutes drive from the city centre.
Big blast of fun. A fun place to hang out on the weekend and surf! Great view of table mountain too...for those who don't surf there are restaurants and shops with the same vibe

Someone needs to look at building regulations. I first went to this beach in 1997 and it was a lovely quiet place with superb views of Table Mountain. When I last returned I found a huge amount of building work had gone on not always to the standard that I really felt fitted in with the surroundings.There is a balance to be struck between the power of the scenery and people's desire to live near the sea and I don't think they've got it right here.One visit I find sandy dunes, the next visit I find a collection of identical two bedroomed houses each with their own miniature gardens with the original landscape destroyed.Cape Town is a victim of its own popularity but don't let me put you off, there is still much to see. For those who have not visited before, you do need a hire car because things are not compact and there is no public transport system that we would understand in Europe. Car hire is cheap enough and the standard of driving fairly good. The only proviso is I would never drive at night if I can possibly help it. This applies more in the country than in the town.

Sun, sea & sand with fantasic views. Walk for miles & miles along this fantastic clean beach while looking towards & taking photographs of the City of Cape Town & Table Mountain. Can be windy & the sea here is freezing but its a great spot......

best place to photograph Table Mountain. Go to Bloubergstrand Beach and look across toward Table Mountain…there she stands in all her glory with the city of Cape Town nestled below…best place to get her picture….truly a Kodak Moment!
My favourite place in the world. I always come back to Bloubergstrand. Most beautiful view of Table mountain. Best place to go for a long walk next to the sea.
Great view onto Table Mountain. Also nice beach (not for swimming) but splash around in the waves. Restaurant Blue Peter ok, more for the view than for the food.

Great beach and fantastic surroundings. The only downside is that the sea is far to rough to swim in. I suppose that's why everyone was there with surf boards and wind sailing equipment. Still well worth visiting, lovely restaurants and shopping malls so plenty to do.a so much so I am looking to purchase a holiday home there and take up surfing.

THE View. We got off the plane and drove directly to Blouberg so our children would see Table Mountian and the bay from there on a perfect clear day..... there is nothing like that view! We found a great spot to eat right on the beach and parking was no problem. Only good if the day is clear.

Side Car Tour to Bloubergstrand. We took a side car tour to Bloubergstrand Beach. We spent several hours stopping at various points. It was a lovely beach that we would come back to if we are ever in Cape Town again. You have lovely views of the city and ocean. It was Heritage Day and we saw hand gliders above and many people on the beach. We did not stop at the many restaurants and shops that we saw. I believe this would be fun thing to do while visiting the beach on our own. I look forward to revisiting the area.

Weekend options. Bloubergstrand caters for everyone, you can walk on the broadwalk, cycle, have a meal, walk on the beach, eat ice-cream, have a drink, surf or do just about anything.Parking can be challenging and the sea is cold but a great place to meet friends and relax.
Lovely. We stayed in Bloubergstrand for a weeks holiday. We all enjoyed it so much I don't think we will book at another place in Cape Town again. Lovely sunset view and view of Table Mountain.
Great views of Cape Town. Scenically it is a beautiful beach. You can watch the kite-surfers doing there thing. It gets very windy but well worth yhe visit.

What a view!!. An amazing experience. A view of Table Mountain that you'll only see from this side of Cape Town. Small restaurants are available for a meal . The Kite Surfers make for good photo opportunities .

WINDY BEACH. Great, never-ending beaches, views, views and views – sometime it feels as if you can walk over to Robben Island – Table Bay and Table Mountain is always spectacular form here! Some spots with great surf, cold (very cold...) water. The seemingly ever-present windy conditions are great for kite-surfing – with literally 100’s of kites zipping along the beach on a “good” day.Decently spaced toilets with showers and changing facilities, a well maintained esplanade meandering along the beach, bicycle paths and good supporting infrastructure.Funky right-on-the-beach hang-outs such “Ons Huisie”, Blue Peter, Moyo’s and many others make for a festive feel and cosy refuges if the wind really starts picking up.The on big down-turn – dogs, or no, people with dogs that don’t clean-up behind their dogs…… it seems to be a local cultural ting – owners just don’t seem to “pick-up” along this stretch of pristine natural beauty – not on the beach, nor on the walkways!Did I mention the wind?!? You have to like it or accept it……All things considered, a great destination.
what splendor!. best fish and chips at The Huizie, also a lovely little French tea shop and much more! the view on table mountain is breath taking!!

Awsome Place to Stroll & Play. We love this Beach Incredible Views of Table Mountain which is always changing with the Weather.View of Robbin Island Lots always going on from Wind Surfing to Kite Boarding I close my Eyes and think I'm in San Diego.We walk this Beach every day and spend most nights having Sun Downer's at the Various Cool Resturants and Bars.

Best view of Table Mountain. This is the place to go to see the view of Table Mountain that's in all the photos and paintings. It's a lovely place with a nice beach but its always so windy there that its a chore often to even sit out at a bar for a drink.
Wind Blowing Experience. generally been there in the late evenings to watch sunset or a special event at night, like a fireworks display. Beautiful views but be prepared to get sand blasted
Great view of Table Mountain. This is the place to take the classic photo of Table Mountain! GPS coordinates of the car park: 33.803160, 18.461410

Spectacular view. I visit Bloubergstrand and its two restaurants:On the Rocks and
Ons Huisie regular for the food and view.

Great view, not always that clean. This is the spot to visit for sunsets and photo opportunities of the Mountain. The beach is very popular with kite surfers and can get crowded. Have also noticed litter there. Many restaurants and shops in the area if you want to get a bite to eat.
Photo opportunity. Best place to take the classic photo(s) of Table Mountain. Highly recommended. Beach and sea, sun and sand, what more could you want.
Great views. The best view of Table Mountain from a distance looking over the bay. The beach has white sand and very hot in Summer, but winter can be windy and rainy.

A beautiful sunset with the view of the Table Mountain. We liked it, because it is not full with tourists, there are a few resstaurants with very good fishfood, coming htere is easy and not far from Cape Town.
We went on several different days, when the weather was nice, when the weather was lousy, it is always beautiful.

take my Breath Away. This is one of teh most exquisite beaches in the world, even though the icy waters do not permit swimmimg. It's great for kite surfing, surfing, and other water sports. How some people commented there is little to do in the area is beyond me. The entire beach front area is laced with bars, shops, great restaurants and amazing seafood can be had! Check out the Onse Huisie (our little house) restaurant where traditional West coast quisine can be enjoyed in a national heritage house, with sweeping views over the ocean as waves break only metres away.

Location, Location, Location. Bloubergstrand. Well you know all those super views of Cape Town with the Table Mountain soaring above the city and Lion's Head mountain. Those are taken from BloubergStrand. The Strand, the beach is white sand and stretches for miles. Unless you are VERY hardy it is best to forget swimming. The water is icy cold - this is the South Atlantic. A walk on the beach - just soaking up the views is well worth it but check the season - in September it was 'blerry cold."

Perfect for Photos. This is a beautiful spot for photos, with an amazing view of table mountain. if your on vacation in Cape Town, this picture will be your album cover. There is little else to do in the area, so you wont stay long, but the beach is beautiful with white white sand, and the water is ok to put your feet in, but to cold for any deeper.

very nice view on the Table Mountain!. At Bloubergstrand Beach you have a very beautiful view on Cape Town and the Table Mountain! We visited this place in September and it was very cold and windy, but there were no many clouds :) When it is raining and there are a lot of clouds, you don't see anything of Cape Town. You can also see Robbeneiland in front of the beach. And you can drink or eat something in The Blue Peter at the Beach. When it's good weather you can sit outside.
EXCELLENT SEAFOOD AT DIE HUISIE. Die Huisie restaurant is right on the Blouberg beachfront and has excellent views of table mountain and Robben Island.
the best place for photos. The best place to get the iconic pictures of Table Mountain across table bay... and some good cafe's and bars around as well, worth an afternoon to sit on the beach
One of my favourite beaches in Cape Town. Very clear views of Table Mountain and Robben Island.Water very cold,but long stretches of beaches and scenery makes up for it.
Go, you won't regret it. Beautiful view over the water to Cape Town and Table Mountain. Have a glass of chilled white wine and soak it all in !

It's a breeze!. A most beautiful beach and fantastic views of table mountain. Exceptional for wind sports and plenty of parking.
Glad to see they finally got rid of the grounded tanker!
Relaxing day. This was a real nice place, the nature and the surroundings are really beautiful. The people is great and the restaurants around are good and not too expensive.
Iconic view. This is the view everyone sees of table mountain, lovely beach and fantastic views. Good eating places close.

The place to take pictures of Table Mountain. Bloubergstrand is by far my favorite place in Cape Town. If you want to take beautiful pictures of Table mountain and the sea, this is where you should be: postcard quality. You can sit or walk for hours here and forget about all troubles and cares. Really beautiful and worth the drive if you stay in another part of Cape Town. A must for international visitors.

Mountain and Robben Island views. The beach stretches for ever. Be warned that its not safe to swim! Swimming and surfing etc at Little Bay and Big Bay. Stunning view from the beach.One can imagine the first explorers landing here, in awe.
Table Mountain photo framed. If you are lucky and table mountain isn't covered in clouds, you will definitely get the best postcard shot of the mountain.

Best place for photos of Table Mountain across the bay. The water is very cold on this side and it is more likely to be windy than not, but it is worth the drive out there just for the best photos with Table Mountain in the background. It is also a windsurfer's paradise.

Best view of Tableberg Mountain. Cute restaurants, people walking there dogs, people just sitting and relaxing, this all you can find here. The beach is beautifull and awesome views. Always goes there when I am in Cape Town.
Beautiful view of Table Mountain. Whenever I visit Cape Town I go to Bloubergstrand Beach at least a couple of times per week. The view across the bay to Table Mountain is quite stunning.

What a view. This has been said many times before but I will say it again. This is THE most stunning view of Table Mountain ever, Anybody visiting Cape Town HAS to drive out there to witness it. The view makes all the negative comments here irrelevant.

Magnificent view. For the picture postcard view of Table Mountain, this is where you must visit. You have not 'seen' Table Mountain until you view it from here. Get onto the beach, listen to the crashing waves and take in the splendour.

Head to Melkbos. For a quiet rural beach head to Holbaai or some of the surrounding beaches in Melbosstrand. For awesome views of Table mountain that will make quintessential holiday pics for your collection this beach is highly recommended. You could take the My Citi to Melkbos. Pack your beach essentials and enjoy the sun. This is on the Atlantic seaboard so water are quite cold, bring a wet suit and surfboard if you are into surfing. Shops and eateries are to be found in Melbos "proper" but it is more congested here.
Cold water, gorgeous views. Cold water of the Atlantic makes a good laugh for the people not used to it, but the views towards Table Mountain are gorgeous.
lil trashy. the best part of it is calm waters to learn how to surf and the view.. otherwise it is trashy place...
Long beautiful beach. A lovely stretch of golden beaches - with outstanding views across the bay of Table Mountain & the City.

The best photos of Table Mountain. We came here to take photos of Table Mountain, really worth it. This is about 25 minutes drive from Cape Town if there is no traffic, in traffic it can take about 45 minutes. The beach is almost empty during winter with just few dog walkers around, the view is perfect.

pretty pretty pretty. nice and chilled vibe on this beach. closeby to a load of restaurants and shops. not too busy, so a perfect little relaxed spot. lovely view of the table mountain as well. one I'll never tire of.

See CT from a different angle. This is a great beach and popula with couples, families, joggers, the lot. You get to see Cape Town from a different perspective. It is from this angle that you are able to see why Table Mountain is said to be looking like a table. The beach is clean, there are places to eat and generally enough parking. Try it

Kite Surfers a plenty. If the wind is good, then the kite surfers make a fantastic addition to this wonderful scenic spot. My husband is a keen amateur photographer and loves getting those action shots of the kite surfers at play. Even without them, the views over the bay are magnificent. Lovely area for people cycling, jogging, walking the dogs or just taking a gentle stroll. We watched the fireworks from the beachfront on New Years Eve this year and even though the weather was terrible,the fireworks were still happening and hopefully we will be there again this year with better weather. Avoid the Cape Town traffic jams as you get just as nice a view of the fireworks across the bay without the madness of the crowds

Stunning Views. Bloubergstrand Beach would be perfect if not for the freezing cold water. Stepping in, you feel as if your brain is going to explode and that your bones will break if you take another step in. The Kite Surfers love it but even they would not venture in without a wetsuit. Safe and clean. Leave your fishing rod at home as the only thing you would catch there is a cold.

Artist's inspiration. I can see why many artists have chosen this destination for paintings. Scenic and clean, many come here to walk, jog, meditate or play in the shallows. We bring our kids here every weekend to unwind.

What a view!. Fantastic view on the table mountain and on Capetown. Definately worth the detour!The beach itself is wide and beautiful,sit down or have a walk and seize this special moment in your life.
Best view of Cape Town. If you ever wondered where those postcard photo's are taken go to Bloubergstrand and you will get the view!!!

Clean beach with a wreck nearby. This is a lovely beach with a stunning view of Robben Island and Table Mountain. All the shops are near and plenty to choose from. Lovely clean beaches with toilets close by.

Expected more. Just a nice beach with a spectacular view. Disappointed about restaurants and facilities behind. Take your camera and go just before sunset. I was a bit windy and chilly too in May, bring along a light jacket! Taxis are hardly found nearby so if you are taking one there make sure you get his number so you can call one and go back safe to town.
Awesome Winds. World class spot for kitesurfing South Easterly winds make this place super special. Big Bay Especially.

Great views of Table Mountain. We rented a lovely condo near the beach for a week and thoroughly enjoyed the spectacular views and sunsets from our 4th floor balcony. The kite surfers were amazing to watch! A nice place to be away from the city, but still close enough to visit. Just wish there were some better restaurants there. Plenty of pizza, sushi and take-away though.

Icy cold water, but glorious sun downers. There is only ONE way you should experience Bloubergstrand - Go to the Blue Peter Restaurant, order some beer and pizza and watch the sun set right over Robben island. The views of Table mountain is quite spectacular from Bloubergstrand, and when it is low tide, you can walk quite deep in to some sand banks of Bloubergstrand. Or do some kite surfing when the wind blows (which is often).
Cold water Superb beauty. Long white beaches, view of the ships coming into the harbor and the mountain naturally. This is our home town and we love surfing and long walks on the beach.
stunning. get away from the crowds by walking along the long sandy beach drinking in that well known view of Table Mountain. Buzzy, happy place with plenty going on
Two Words: Kite Surfers. You'll see wind surfers and regular surfers as well but I could sit for hours and watch the wind surfers!

Breath Taking Beauty. Overlooking the Atlantic Ocean. Table Mountain magestically positioned across the water. Robin Island in clear view.White stretches of beach, families, children and dogs walking along the beach and the promenade. Dare devil kite surfers, jiggers and cyclists add to the mix. An eclectic mix of restaurants to relax in and enjoy a meal and drink with special people. An experience to treasure.

Best beach for Table Mountain views. This is place where most of the postcards of Cape Town and Table Mountain are taken. The views are amazing. Its a fairly safe beach too but exposed to the winds. Great for sunset walks and kite surfing.

Even when its windy it looks spectacular. This beach presents all that you want's. If the weather is bad just sit and admire the kite surfers. Careful of the doggy poo. Their owners is a bit reckless but look very happy to have a place still to run their dogs.
clean beach. this is the beach of preference for my family on a Sunday afternoon. very freindly icecream vendor makes the experience all the nicer!

great for families. Blougerg is quite a windy area, especially when compared to the sheltered clifton beaches.It was very windy when we were there, but full of families. There are a large variety of self-catering accommodation within walking distance of the the beaches. The water is cold, but because of the wind it's great for wind-surfing and similar water-sports.

Perfect view of Table Top. Sections of the beach were slightly littered, plastic bottles etc., but the view of Table Top is just incredible. I visited Table View Beach to go kit surfing, sadly no wind so decided to walk down the beach to Lagoon Beach.

Visit because of the view. I did not find character, struggled with adeqaute parking and it is obvious that not much is done to make the beach 'user friendly'. However, the postcard view of Table Mountain is what draws me to Bloubergstrand beach every time.
The best view of Table Mountain. Mile upon mile of pure white sand, and there is no better place to take your pictures of Table Mountain.
Seaside. We stayed near the beach and didn't regret a minute. The views and walks are fantastic, the view of table mountain is exquisite. Fantastic for surfing.

If you need some wind, it's the place. It is definitively a road to drive on
to enjoy sunset on table mountain.
SUPERB
Fresh air, plenty of restaurants, and some places where the girls are warm. Try "Peter blue" to enjoy a nice pizza where it'scrowded of young people laying down with a drink to enjoy good time at 6pm

beautiful view of Table Mountain and Cape Town at Sunset. very nice place to watch the sunset over Robben Island and then look back to Table Mountain. New development on the area, with a wide assortment of restaurants.

Windswept. The water is unbearably icy cold for swimming but watching the kite surfers in the afternoon is amazing. With the right wind conditions there are hundreds of kite surfers in the water - great for taking spectacular photos.There are a few eateries and bars along the main road after taking a brisk walk. They don't appear to be very classy places, just average, however they have a magnificent view of Table Mountain across the bay. There is plenty of parking (with the obligatory parking attendants expecting tips). The only complaint is that it can get very windy as it's very exposed to the elements. The sand from the beach blows across the road - there is a desperate need for environmental help for this beach. We noticed a feeble attempt at planting grasses on one section of the beach but a wall should be built between the footpath and the sand to stop the sand from moving across the road.

Bloubergstrand beach. Can be very windy, but the view of robin island and table mountain is stunning, always , kite surfers,. Suffers, wind surfing. And if you're lucky you can watch the seals playing in the surf

Blouberg Beach. Way too many people by far and the South Easter will bury you in fine white sand if you sit in one place for more than 5 minutes - gets in everywhere and is really uncomfortable. Good for the kite-surfers but a pain for the rest of us “normal” folk. The only good thing is the view of Table Mountain. Stay away is my advice, honestly.
With Cape Town and Table Mountain as back-drop. Where the pictures of "Cape Town with towering Table Mountain overhead" are shot from! Nice beach but oftentimes windy. Great for kitesurfing.

Sunny and relazed. Space on the beach, clean and water perfect. There were lots of parking, toilets to visit and vendors to buy food and beverages. It was relaxed and not crowded with too many people. The tide was low and we were able to walk up to the rocks.
Splendid views. It goes without saying that you get the best perspective of Table Mountain from this pristine beach and look to your right and you see Robben Island too!

Fantastic view of Table Mountain. The beach is not as well kept as one would like but the view is worth a visit. The sea is cold and although I did not visit the cloakrooms, they looked a little questionable
Just amazing. What a beautiful beach. The views are breathtaking. The people are so friendly, little piece of heaven.

BLOUBERGSTRAND UNKNOWN BEST SPOT WHEN IN CAPE TOWN. To have this view, and enjoy being on the beach, the only place to stay is at Pinard on Sea. Absolutely fabulous, little known, Boutique Hotel (literally on the rocks) surrounded by fabulous restaurants like "On the Rocks" and "Ons Huisie" and moments that can only be created by the Cape of Good Hope.

I could die very happy here. As you enter Blouberg you are immediately mesmerised by the kite surfers - takes you a while to figure out that they are actually surfing and flying a kite simultaneously. This is as close to heaven on earth as it gets - the beach is not crowded - obviously cannot swim due to the cold water but the most relaxing beach around. loved it

The best view in the world!. What more can you say! It is the very best few in the world and the closest you can get to Robben Island apart from on a boat. We were there on a clear day and it is such a special place!
Bloubergstrand Beach. Miles of beach with great views of Table Mountain. On a windy day as many as 100 Kite surfers can be seen having fun.
Windswept beach. You will love this beach if you are a windsurfer but it's not one where you might swim and sunbathe. However, the natural surroundings make it worth a visit.

Plenty to see. Bloubergstrand is a long area of unspoilt beaches facing Table Mountain and Cape Town. The sea is a bit cold and the waves usually quite big but for an evening stroll or just to sit and watch the waves crashing in it is bliss. Take a walk further up to Big Bay and there are plenty of bars and restaurants to sit and watch the surfers and Kite surfers in action.
Beach Beauty. Best beach for views of Table Mountain. Great walking beach. Too cold to swim and can get windy. Kite surfers paradise. Many surrounding hotels and food outlets.

Love it - but they have to improve some things!. I love the view, the beach - even the ice cold water :-)But it is run done - some toilets are buried in sand, the wooden paths are partly destroyed, the police is busy harassing dog walkers - and seems to occupied to notice the homeless people or take care of people throwing away their rubbish without shame...and I will not even start talking about that wreck...or oilStill - I would rate it "very good" - but it could be much more
Beautiful beaches but cold to swim. Feels like paradise - stunning blue waters and white sands, but the water is icy cold to swim in. A must to go check out the area, and the shipwreck.
Nice View To cold. to cold to swim . but nice beach. windy but view of table mountain is the best. needs to be more easily accessed

Blouberg. Who cannot include this picturescue place on your itinerary.You get the most beautiful view of Table Mountain from Blouberg.You feel like being in another world and will leave Blouberg with good memories.Eat an ice cream stroll around or sit in your car if the wind makes it impossible to walk on the beach. Toilet facilities disgusting . A must see.

Best picture moment. Beautiful popular beach. Chill by the cosy restuarants or pack a picnic basket and enjoy the best view of Table Mountain. Enjoy sundowners by the Blue Peter and watch the breathtaking sunset. Don't miss it! This is your perfect spot for pictures of the mountain which will take a special place in your album.
Very Good Family Beach. Great family beach to swim, tan, have a picnic, children can play. Nice Ice cream stands, view of table mountain and Robben Island, and boats.
Holiday Beach. Very nice beach and surrounding area. The news cafe in Bloubergstrand area is one of my favorite in South Africa.

The spot for photos of table top. You have seen it on post card so here is the spot to take fantastic photos of table moutain, we we went twice sunset and mid morning, local eating places great beach lots of parking and good security
