Very nice beach. Enjoyed every minute of our stay on the beach - clean, white sand (looks like one of those exotic beaches that one sees only in magazines), close to all amendities, security.
Best view in the Cape. Make sure to visit Blue Peter and watch the sunset from the grass area in front of the pub, while enjoying an Ice cold beverage
windy. the only good thing was the view across the bay of table mountain other than that would not bother to ever go there again. boring. windy as hell. no thank you
A very peaceful, relaxing place. It is a very nice place to relax with family and enjoy the fresh air, there are also really nice restaurantsthere!

Visit to Blouberg Beach. Beautiful clean beach with clean toilet facilities. Clearly a haven for kite surfers and fun to watch. Blouberg is beautiful with the ful view of Table Mountain. Many restaurants and shopping centres all around.
Very pretty. A beautiful area of Cape Town with white beaches and a close community. My cousin has lived there for a few years and loves it! We can't wait to go back!

Wonderful view, a great place. Blaauberg Strand has perhaps the best view of Table Mountain. Only Robben Island has any hope of competing as a vantage point. At the outset, let me caution you: Blaauberg Strand is NOT for the casual swimmer. The surf is rough. Also, Cape Town has a cold side and a warm side (sea temperature), and Blaauberg Strand is very definitely on the cold side. You will not swim here, even on the hottest day! But apart from the great views, Blaauberg Strand also offers an expansive beach that is magical to walk along, literally for miles if you wish. There are good restaurants, and just sitting on the bech or walking along it are rewarding in their own right. It is also a mecca for surfers and kiteboarders

Great escape from the city. The miles of beautiful white sand are good for kiters, surfers, swimmers and sun worshipers. Worth a visit when the winds are up just to see the tens of kiters weaving and jumping. I ran along the beach everyday for a week and never tired of the view of Table Mountain. Cafe of choice = Carluccis at the Table View end of the strand.

The Classic View. It is beautiful, and surprises visitors that you are looking South instead of North. The only other place you will get as good a view is from Robben Island. Always breathtaking, even when the weather is not at its best.
Excellent beach for surfers and just walking along golden sands. Yes can be windy but just wonderful to walk along this beach and to watch the sun down my favorite spot is at Blue Peter !

fresh air and wonderful views. Brilliant white sands, virtually empty beaches stretching miles, and wonderful views of the distant Table Mountain, and city centre.But there was also plenty of fresh air; and the Atlantic winds really blow here.

Could Be Called Blowberg. The iconic Table Mountain pics are often taken from Blouberg beach. This place is seriously windy especially in the summer. A popular kite surfing area. But cant compare to the Camps Bay, Clifton even Muizenberg beaches.
great vieuw. In Bloubergstrand, you have a very good vieuw on the Table Mountain and ag good restaurant "Ons Huisie", they have good lobster.

Sundowner excellence. Nothing beats sitting on the lawn with a cold beer, watching the sun sink into the ocean. As you watch the last rays disappear, you can then watch all the locals posing up and down the strip in all sorts of motorised transport from Porsches to heaps of junk!!
Opposite my brothers house. Couldn't miss a visit on the hottest day in September - thirty degrees Clean beach in a nature conservation area
Sunset-tastic. THE place to go for great sunsets towards Table Mountain and Lions Head as the city lights up in front of your eyes. Always worth a quick visit.
Great beach. From Kite boarding to ice creams on the beach, this beach is stunning and has access to the beach front were you can get some food have a night out. This is a definate mst see...
beautiful views. beautiful views of cape town. take a nice stroll along the beach and take a picnic basket. loads of sun watching kitesurfers

So beautiful!. This beach has a gorgeous view of the mountains in the city and sports soft, white sand. There's parking against the beach that is easy to catch, and there's a lot of great restaurants near by to grab a bite to eat after relaxing in the sun.
Beautiful Beach. Lovely beach with white sand and miles of it too. Kite flying and delis ice creams at The Sea Breeze.
Blouberg Beach. It is very beautiful and stunning view of Table Mountain & Robben Island it is good for beach walk the beach is very active with kite surfers

Wow - had to drag her away. We stopped on this beach in several spots on our final day for Driving around the western cape
I had a hard time getting Sabine back into the car so that we could return it to the Hire company before being penalised...
Come here with time to spare... it is quite an amazing beach. But do it in the summer.

Blue flag status - enough said. One of the most pristine beaches in South Africa. Was awarded blue flag status. Very safe and spectacular views of Table Mountain. Can get very windy as well though. Lots of pubs and restaurants all along the beach road with excellent B&Bs as well.

Beautiful views and so much more. Windy and chilly during our stay but the views and excellent restaurants - especially Ons Huise - far outweighed the weather conditions. Clean, super-organised, lovely.
Excellent Beach. We loved the clean beach with the beautiful view. We had lunch at Ons Huisie and spent some time sitting on Bloubergstrand Beach chatting with friends that we came to visit.

Sundowner Magic!. Sitting at the Blue Peter whilst the sun goes down is an awesome experience. The staff continually clean up glasses and cigarette butts from the grass, there was a live band when we were there on Sunday eve 16th Sept and the vibe was super.

Great view, thats about it.. Wonderful view of Table Mountain, but very little to do otherwise. A good restaurant called On the Rocks is worth the visit, and Ons se Huisie for true South African food.

Parasurfing paradise. A long, long, long stretch of beautiful white sandy beach. Gets lots of visitors on a sunny day - the sight of all the parasurfers with their multi-coloured 'sails' makes you want to get out there! Great restaurants can be found all along the strip.

Best view on Table Mountain. We are lucky enough to live close to this beach and can enjoy the fantastic view on Table Mountain almost everyday. It is a must view during your stay in Cape Town! The beach is very long and never crowded. During the windy summer months, this is also the best spot for Wind- and Kitesurfers.
Interesting view. Very interesting panoramic view on Table Moutain and Cape Town, very nice beach with plenty of shells if you like to collect them.
Iconic beach with Table Mt backdrop. Iconic beach with Table Mountain as a backdrop, beautiful, clear but cold water, it can get really windy, so choose a calm day, its truly magnificent
The Best Views of Table Mountain. The walks along this beach, especially around sunset are some of the best ever experienced. That's why I live there.
A wndy place. A loveley sandy beach with table mountain in her classical pose as a background. As it is the Atlantic expect it to be windy, there are many kite surfers along here and Table View.

Stunning place, best view of table mountain.. I love looking across the bay to the mountain. Sometimes it has its table cloth(clouds) and sometimes it is so clear and stunning. One can see all the cargo ships go across the bay. See the city under the mountain. There are a few stunning beaches and lovely restaurants to sit and watch the waves. Love it. Go there regularly.

Great Place - Home is where the Heart is. Lots to see and do ... Great pubs ... even when the wind is howling !!
Doodles the best pub in the area - great vegetarian options on the menu tooooooo...

Post Card views of Table Mountain. Blouberg Beach is a favorite for joggers, walkers and kite surfers who enjoy this long sandy beach. You will get the best view of the Mothercity framed by the iconic Table Mountain. Plenty of free parking.
clean and bright. great beach, way to little law enforcement visible, the gays at the end of the beach are just disgusting

Glorious Views of Magnificent Table Mountain. Blouberg beach stretches for miles - lovely white sand and glorious views of the most famous Table Mountain.On a sunny winter's day in Cape Town, it is a superb spot to be to soak up some sun, gaze at the mountain and enjoy breakfasts/lunches or sundowners whilst still gazing at the mountain.There are a number of restaurants in the area, many with sea views.The beach can get windy in summer which makes it a great favourite with kite surfers from all over the world. Watching these kite/wind surfers do their moves while tearing along at speed, makes for an interesting backdrop to the mountain.The sea is cold but most refreshing.Don't miss an outing to Blouberg beach while in Cape Town - it's a world famous view!

Seems very familiar.... Of course...this is the iconic vantage point to take photos of Table Mountain and Cape Town. The beach is pretty windy, but the view is gorgeous! Whilst the area is very residential, there are little coffee shops dotted around, otherwise you could be in Brighton!
Postcard. Lovely, Picture Postcard views. Gets windy and full in season ... but plenty of space and restaurants at Blue Bay

Maybe the world's most beautiful single view. The coast around Cape Town is the most beautiful coast on earth, imho, based on a fair amount of travel! It is more beautiful than the Amalfi coast, and more beautiful than Big Sur in California and I would even say it is more beautiful than the magnificent Garden Route that heads East from Cape Town toward Port Elizabeth. Of every single view along this scenic marvel, Bloubergstrand is probably number 1, and may be the most beautiful single view on earth. A trip to the magnificent 'Mother City' is not complete without a trip to, and picture from, this amazing spot.

Just beautiful. The best spot from where to have a magnificent view of Table Mountain with Devil's Peak and Leeukop on both sides - a view not to be missed and cold be found nowhere else in the world - beauty of nature at its best
One of the 7 Wonders of the World!. Hard to find a more beautiful scene! The MOUNTAIN. the white beach, the blue sea, dark rocks..... the med atmosphere....

The views..... ....says it all. And a beautiful beach. If you into water sports, get your kite out and have fun - Restaurants are up and comming but drive further up the coast, to the new watterfront;-)
Magical. Always blown away by the sheer beauty... Great restaurants @ Eden on the Bay.

Untidy. the beach needs a clean, there were lots of papers and 'stuff' on the sand which was really upsetting. The area near the Life Guard station was awful, there was horrible brown 'water' flowing into the sea. So sad because these views are unsurpassed.
Go for the view. A must do if you want the classic photo for your album back home. Beach surprisingly quiet.

great views of Cape Town and Table Mt. wonderful views of the city with the stunning Table mt backdown. Nice beaches and beautiful sunset to view over the water. Enjoy a nice refreshment from the Blue Peter and admire the wonderful views.
What a view. This beach offers the classic postcard view of Cape Town and Table Mountain. Great for wind surfing but the water can be chilly at times
Windy. Must be the windiest spot in the cape - Great views of Table mountain

really good particularly if there is little wind. water is cold. Surf, Kiteboarding, SUP mecca. Loads of good food and drinking spots. Carlucci coffee shop is a favourite with the locals, small always packed. Eden on the bay has many good spots to eat and drink. Take in Moyo's on a hot day with tables in a shallow pond
THe very symbol of Cape Town. Is Table Mountain - as viewed from this beach. Can be windy and hot. Worth the effort and great for taking photos of the famous view!!
Primi Night. We went out for a great dinner at primi and for a walk on the beach.
Nicest beach. Beautiful soft white sand, clean, and the most activities happening - surfers, kite surfing, etc

West coast is not for me!. Besides the cool view of table mountain, it's wind swept, home to a nuclear power station, stark and the water is freezing! Southern suburb beaches are way better in terms of swimming and beauty.

Nice views but a bit dirty. I like the views from Bloubergstrand. The surfing and kite surfing are good, and you can go for long walks on this seemingly endless beach. However, the beach itself is a bit dirty and there are very few showers along the beach. Not really my top choice in Cape Town.

Picture Perfect. It is from here that those iconic shots across the water to Cape Town and Table Mountain are taken. Not really any other strong reason to visit. From Cape Town you get to Sunset Beach before Bloubergstrand - the pictures are the same and the beach is better.
Kitesurfer's Dream. Pretty beach with lovely views of the mountain. Also perfect spot for kitesurfing.
Water very cold. If you are into long walks, then this is for you. You can walk to Table View or Melkbos from here. Visit the Blue Peter for a sundowner. The evenings are great.

Long walks with great mountain views. Bloubergstrand is a great place should you want to take long walks on the beach, especially in the late afternoon. The beach offers fantastic views and photographic opportunities of Table Mountain and there are many restaurants and bars nearby.
Wow. This is a beautiful unspoiled beach with a huge choice of restaurants close by. Lots ro see and do but perfect just to sit and watch the kite surfers
Picture Postcard. A nice beach, perfect views of table mountain - lots of bars, restuarants along the beachfront!
Stunning view, but hold onto your hat!. The best view of Table Mountain - great for photo's. But the wind really does blow at this beach. Fun if you're a kite-surfer.
Amazing View. Blouberg is well woth a visit. You get a stunning view of Table mountain and the sunsets are amazing. It is also very popular with kite surfers.
Good view. This gives you the classic view of Table Mountain from across the bay. Good for photographs but better beaches at Camps Bay and nearer to Cape Town.

A holiday destination visit for Local Capetonians. What a view you get of Table Mountain! And the long white sand unspoilt beach... It's like going on holiday in your own backyard. Safe, friendly, facilites with a number of famous eating places nearby. A place to chill and have fun, relax or just stroll or run along the beach. Swimming and Kite Surfing big over here. And Robben Island looks like you can pluck it out the sea. The wind can get a bit out of hand...
THE View. Officially the BEST spot to take pics of the most beautiful mountain in the world
Views to die for. Great part of cape town, do not go on a windy day and take your camera.

See Table Mountain like on the postcards!. This is a great beach to go to and the views to table mountain can be spectacular. Water is not really swim-able as it is freezing, cut there is nothing more refreshing than jumping into icy cold water and having some body parts turn blue after a bit.... still fun.The thing I dislike the most is the wind.. the constant blowing wind here and in Cape Town generally is what turns a nice day into a day of trying to fighting to keep your eyes open.The locals and others are use to it, it seems and take the opportunity to wind surf and kite surf.The other warning about the beaches in Cape Town is about the sun. The sun can be really intense and it is easy to get sun burnt. This with a howling wind, make you feel like you've been through a dessert blizzard when you get back your hotel.If you wear a Hat, sunscreen, sunglasses, you are all set.
Fabulous beach and views. Some great restaurants here, plus a great view back to Table Mountain. Also you can spend many an hour watching the Kite surfers.....

Beautiful, perfect. I live in the area. It is magic. Walk here daily. Lovely view of Table Mountain. Beach has many moods, often windy when it is good for wind sports. One must be careful of over zealous law enforcement officers.
Fantastic view to Table mountain. Long beach to walk on and have a fantastic view towards Table Mountain
There are better.... Bloubergstrand beach is not bad, but there are definately 'better' beaches in Cape Town, such as Camps Bay, Clifton and Big Bay. Can be a little deserted and unsafe at times.
A beach like no other - clean sand.... Excellent tourist destination. A beach that has clean sand, amazing views and a definite place to relax and unwind.
Bloubergstrand. Stunning view of the Mountain from a beautiful white beach!

Small Bay is great for the kids with a park for them to play in and the sea is safe and not rough at all ,. loved Eden on the bay, sitting having cocktails and looking at table mountain, and all the kite boarders and surfers surfing. Beauty and View is un comprehendable. Something that you have to experience in your lifetime.
Happy Travellers. One of the most amazing beaches in the world with Table Mountain as a backdrop,lots of eating establishments and very safe.

Perfect secluded beach facing the beautiful mountain. This is where I live. You walk out of my house and straight onto the beach. It is absolutely divine. Not a lot of tourists and full of locals. Typically you can see surfers, stand up paddlers, kite surfers everywhere.
Absolutely stunning and relatively non- commercialised.

Windy west coast. The classic view of Table Mluntain is from Bloubergstrand beach about30 minutes drive from Cape Town on the coast road towards Malmesbury. Good place for sunsets and for food, and for kite surfing.

very nice beaches. its not to full and you have a feeling of space
sometimes you need to go in the morning as in the afternoons it gets a bit windy, but i loved it

what a view of Table Bay and the mountain.. There are so many photos and postcards of this beach with our beautiful iconic mountain in the background but you have to visit it in person to fully appreciate it. On a clear day the view out to Robben Island is also good. Although the coastline here is not really good for swimming, there's lots of activity from kites, windsailing, paragliding and of course surfing. It's rarely empty even on the coldest winter days. The sand is lovely and it's very popular with families with small children who have nopt yet got to the "swimming" stage. Take a picnic, get there early before the sun gets too strong and enjoy the views.

Always a nice cool breeze if it is boiling anywhere else. A wonderful wide, white open beach and you can walk for miles. We usually go there with our dogs and they also love it. After our walks we treat ourselves with a ice cream cone from one of the vendors next to the beach. Divine!
Simply Awful. Dirty, crowded and very poor service at restaurant Zandbar
Stunning views across Table Bay. An excellent opportunity to film or shoot the stunning setting of Cape Town with Table Mountain towering over it.
Awesome windy beach. Cold water and windy beach great for kitting. Loved walking on beach
relaxing. relaxing, though go a km or 2 upwards towards big bay, you wont be sorry!
Best view of Table mt.. The best view of Table mt. beach is Ok, lovely community along the beach front with some good restaurants.

fascinating if it is not a cloudy day. We had our engagement photo shots along the beach, using the Table Mountain as backdrop.......... this is the best decision we've made. Photos came out beautiful and stunning.

Best views of Table Mountain. Like: This beach offers the BEST views of the sea, Table Mountain (and surrounding mountains) and the city of Cape Town. White beaches which are made for walking endless kilometres! A wide range of restaurants in Big Bay, offers dining and other options on the beach - including entertainment for children.
Dislike: the WIND!

The best view of Table Mountain in Cape Town. It's windy and wild, but for the ultimate photo opportunity of Table Mountain, you have to visit Blouberg. It's not particularly touristy especially for foreign visitors, seems to be mostly supported by locals albeit from upcountry like Joburg. A few nice pubs, restaurants making the most of the view, but nothing too sophisticated. So, if you want to see the locals having a good time and to take that perfect pic of Cape Town nestling below the mountain, Blouberg is worth a visit. With the new MyCiti bus service, it's cheap and easy to get to from Cape Town City centre as well.

Great place to stay. Excellent public transportation- bused run often, are very inexpensive, safe and clean- to get to the city of Cape Town. The best part- the view from here is post-card perfect! It's the famous view you always see of Table Mountain.

Worth a visit for the iconic views. Bloubergstrand beach is about a 20 minute drive north of Cape Town. About three/four miles short of it you come into a very newly built up area with high rise flats and eateries and a huge amount of parking - think it may be called Table View. Here you also get excellent views of Table Mountain - probably just as good as Bloubergstrand.There is adequate parking in Bloubergstrand and its outskirts - plenty of car guards around and R5 is well worth paying. Plenty of seats to take in and admire the famous views across the water to Table Mountain. It is a nice walk along the beach which is obviously very popular with locals. There are a couple of nice restaurants and an ice cream van which does a good trade. I did find the constant hawkers to be a bit annoying but then I suppose it is a tourist spot.Overall it is well worth a visit, if only to actually see the view of Table Mountain that you see on so many postcards and calendars.

Miles of beach. Bloubergstrand coveres miles of while sandy beach. The classic view of Table Mountain can be experienced from Bloubergstrand. The beach is used by everybody including kite surfers, families, and dogwalkers.
The beach with the view. The view of Table Mountain is fabulous. Good for exciting photography
Wow what a view. the picture postcard of table mountain that is so famous, great places to eat and drink and a fabulous beach to walk on to get rid of all those extra calories.

Stunning Views of Table Mountain. Blouberg Beach is not for you if you like crowds and sitting cheek by jowl with the next sunbed. Blouberg Beach stretches for miles and is great for a long walk, some sun-tanning, picture taking or eating at one of the many restaurants right near the beach. There is always plenty of space and the beach is favoured by many local Capetonions.Wind-surfers make an interesting sight when the wind is up and there are great views of Table Mountain for those holiday shots. The beach is worth a visit even during winter as the views of Table Mountain are the best!
Disappointment. Found Bloubergstrand to be very uninviting. The only thing we enjoyed was the iconic view across the bay to Table Mountain. Beach was very crowded.

The beach goes on forever. What a fabulous unspoilt beach and a great place to take photos of Cape Town and Table Mountain. Lots of places to stay for a holiday. Would not consider it a must see trip but does add another perspective to the photo collection.
Beautiful Beach. Great place to see Table Mountain, sandy beach and very cold water :)
Picture postcard beach walks and Icy water. Views, Views Views - the ultimate picture postcard spot for photos of the fabled mountain from across Table Bay. Water is icy but paddling is bearable!

best view of table mountain,and beach. Loved the rocky beach,majestic view of table mountain there's a little dutch restauant on the beach,and activity watching in Big Bay close by.Ab-sailing,surfing,people watching.
Fantastic view, seals and birdlife. Easy access, no parking problems, great view back to Table Mountain and very uncrowded.
Great views of the cape. A spot for sun bathing, watching the sun set, watching people, or just to take a few great photos of cape town.
Most beautiful beach in Cape Town. Beautiful clean beach with soft white sand and best view of Table Mountain in Cape Town.
What a view. The Bloubergstrand Beach is the place to go for a nice view of the table mountain and the "skyline" of cape town.

Stunning vista, not so good close up. Phenomenal beach, just too much beach & plastic detritus. I think the beach at Hermanus is the much better option if your starting point is Cape Town: Hermanus is worth the extra 30-40mins car ride.

Incredible view to Table Mountain. We love this part of Cape Town, because it was first place which we visited many years ago and we come back every time when we visit Cape Town, why? Because its many places for quite watching Table Mountain especially over sunset time! Our favourite place for relax time and quickly lunch/breakfest is Blue Pieter Hotel with outside benches place. Our children love costline beaches.

Iconic views of Table Mountain. Whenever I'm in cape Town I love to head here to enjoy the panoramic views , whether it's a walk on the beach at sunrise , sun bathing , a glass of wine at sunset or dinner. There is also a new development called Big Bay which has lots of parking , restaurants (formal indoor and casual beach side ones) and direct access to the beach for walks etc.

Beautiful and close enough to watch the waves from your car.. I live in Cape Town and often go to Bloubergstrand or Blouberg. as we call it. Lovely place to park your car in winter to watch the waves break on the rocks while you sip coffee or have a take away in your car . If you want to brave the cold strong wind in Winter you may prefer a walk along the foot path with the dog. Bring a jacket and a cap to cover your ears from the cold on your walk. Lovely in Summer to play in the rock pools and on the beach. Place to walk through to the ocean to the rocks when the tide is low and the 2 side of the ocean move apart - but always watch the tide so you not stranded on the rocks at high tide. Many little coffee shops , eateries off the beach to come and have breakfast while watching the sea even the Blue Peter Hotel close buy where you can sit on the grass and have a sun downer on a hot summers evening overlooking the sea & Table Mountain in the distance. Wind does blow quite a bit, hens the name Blouberg- sand can sting if you are on the beach -lovely in Summer to cool down. Bring your fish and have a braai ( barbecue ) at the beach.

Best view in the world !. Bloubergstrand (Afrikaans for Blue Mountain Beach) is the best place from where to see and photograph Table Mountain and its attendant peaks with the city of Cape Town reduced to toy town status below the mountains. An unforgettable panorama!This area is only about 20 minutes from central Cape Town on the other side of Table Bay and is reached by an excellent road.Also some interesting restaurants here .But remember this beach is not for swimming - water too cold!

World Class Views, Stunning Beach. This is a beach that you just HAVE to visit. The sands are white and clean and the classic view of Table Mountain across the waters must be the most photographed view in South Africa. You will most certainly earn bragging rights by getting a photograph of yourself on Bloubergstrand Beach with Table Mountain in the background! People go there for 3 things - the views, the sunbathing and the water sports. The waters are cold (you have to go in with a wetsuit) but this does not seem to stop the hordes of adrenalin junkies getting into the water and doing their thing - it is apparently one of the top spots in the world for kiteboarding.The amenities are good - lots of showers and grass to lie on. There is a little tuckshop at Big Bay which sells enough to keep you at the beach if you get peckish, and the beach is patrolled by lifeguards. There is a lot of development on the go to upgrade the facilities so I can only imagine it getting better.The restaurants and b&b's in the area are also very good and all-round it is a wonderful location to spend a few days.Well worth a visit.
